P Cuba GPE is the last stronghold of dictatorship in South America LOC and we must be mindful of this with all due sympathy to Cuba GPE . It is a dictatorship and hence not a democracy. I would during my two minutes TIME like to draw attention to two CARDINAL countries which are close to my heart. P The first ORDINAL country is Indonesia GPE . We are naturally delighted that Indonesia GPE is under new rule and that Mr Wahid PERSON and Mrs Sukarnoputri are the new President and Vice President. We are also pleased that the situation in Timor GPE is slowly moving in the right direction. But I can report that in the Moluccas GPE an area just north of Timor GPE the violence is still not under control. This has claimed thousands CARDINAL of lives over the past two years DATE . Tens of thousands CARDINAL of people are on the run. The situation is badly managed. I know that tomorrow or the day after tomorrow an important programme will be shown on Dutch NORP television in which an appeal will be made for observers. This is with the sole purpose of monitoring what exactly is going on so that at least a record can be made not least for the future for human rights committees of what has been happening. My urgent request which has been echoed many times in resolutions is the following could you not confer so that observers can be sent to the Moluccas GPE ? Surely thousands CARDINAL of people killed thousands CARDINAL wounded and tens of thousands CARDINAL on the run is enough. P My second ORDINAL country I will be brief as Mr Patten knows this country very well is Burma GPE . Surely we cannot just keep silent about Burma GPE . I have the feeling that that country is gradually being relegated to oblivion. For ten years DATE now the elected President of that country has been under house arrest. And for ten years DATE now its parliament has been out of action. Numerous MPs have been killed or have fled the country and only a few are left in Burma GPE . There are hundreds of thousands CARDINAL of refugees in Thailand GPE and India GPE from Burma GPE and yet it seems that that country is no longer given any attention. In my opinion Burma GPE should be put back on the agenda too certainly in the wake of Indonesia GPE s U turn. Surely we cannot tolerate the fact that Mrs Aung San Sui Kyi ORG feels completely left in the lurch even by Europe LOC . My request is in fact to put this country back on the top of the agenda. SPEAKER ID 100 LANGUAGE PT NAME Costa Neves NORP Mr President Mr President in Office ORG Commissioner economic clout cannot be the only factor that determines the European Union s status in the world. One CARDINAL of the EU ORG s distinguishing features is our systematic approach to human rights as exercised both within the Union and by our partners. The European Parliament ORG has been at the forefront of the battle to promote and defend human rights and it has succeeded in overcoming the limits imposed by self interest and national interests which are sometimes reflected in the positions adopted by the Member States and even by other European Union ORG institutions. P We can therefore safely say for example that the European Parliament ORG has never allowed the situation in East Timor GPE to be forgotten which could have been the greatest obstacle to finding an equitable solution for its people who always opposed occupation by Indonesia GPE . By the same token we have recently opposed arms sales to Indonesia GPE a stance that the Council ORG unfortunately did not take into account. But it is not just a question of preventing or putting a stop to sickening instances of aggression perpetrated by individuals or institutions against those in a weaker position. It is vital that when violations are committed the perpetrators should not be able to act with impunity whoever or wherever they may be in Indonesia GPE or Angola GPE in Cuba GPE China GPE or Burma GPE whether the perpetrators are civilians or soldiers humble foot soldier or general or even a minister. Justice needs to be done in Indonesia GPE . Justice ORG needs to be done in East Timor GPE . President Wahid PERSON needs our support to cope with the difficult situation he is faced with. The specific reference in this resolution to East Timor GPE on the initiative of the PPE Group ORG is a timely one. PT Mr President I would like to make a few very brief comments on behalf of the Council ORG presidency and first ORDINAL to remind you that the work done by the presidency is above all about coordination and about seeking common positions on initiatives that the fifteen CARDINAL Member States are to approve in the Council ORG . Our experience of previous sessions of the Human Rights Commission ORG suggests precisely by virtue of this coordinating role played by successive presidencies that the European Union ORG is very much able to uphold its status as a body with its own policy within the Commission and it is important to maintain this. P I would also like to say that the European NORP Parliament ORG s participation in the preparatory work is important in establishing coherent European Union ORG positions on various different issues and that the presidency therefore naturally welcomes all the various suggestions and in particular all the contributions made through the resolutions which have been presented. I would also like to stress as many Members have highlighted that human rights policy is at the heart of Europe LOC s identity and that respect for human rights should be seen as a fundamental principle for international cooperation by the European Union ORG . Hence the need for the most coherent European NORP human rights policy possible which of course means that we need to adopt clear and unambiguous positions where we consider a state of affairs to be unacceptable and I have in mind in particular the references that many Members have made to China GPE . But we have also duly noted the concerns expressed by many other Members about other countries notably Indonesia GPE East Timor GPE the Moluccas GPE and Burma GPE . P I could not conclude without mentioning Mr Van Hecke s speech in particular in which he referred to the human rights situation in Africa LOC and to the role and priorities of the Portuguese NORP Presidency and questioned the sincerity of the priority we are giving to relations with the European Union ORG . I would simply like to say that the Portuguese NORP Presidency has in these two short months DATE organised the first ORDINAL Development Council ORG admittedly an informal one whose agenda was rightly dominated by EU Africa ORG relations. Indeed it was this subject which led the development ministers of the fifteen CARDINAL Member States to meet in Lisbon GPE for discussions specifically on the new era these relations have entered. Furthermore I cannot stress enough the significance of our having concluded important negotiations on the new convention to succeed the Lom Convention and the fact that following extremely complex and difficult negotiations we have succeeded in organising or making preparations for the organisation of the first ORDINAL EU Africa Summit. For all these reasons I thought it essential to reply directly to Mr Van Hecke s question on this issue. SPEAKER ID 102 CARDINAL NAME Patten . Mr President this has been a very useful debate. It was a remarkable speech and I hope that Mr Gollnisch who is no longer able to be with us was able to hear that speech as well. I also hope that if there is any life in outer space as has been speculated by Mr Newton Dunn PERSON it was tuned in to Mr Havel s speech as well. Mr Havel reminded us that the Union is not just about markets about GDP growth it is a Union of values that is reflected in the Treaties and is reflected in our obligations in the whole area of external assistance reflected quite specifically in what we are charged to do. How do we implement what the Treaties say in all those words about development assistance programmes? P One CARDINAL or two CARDINAL honourable Members Mr Ferber and Mr Cushnahan spoke about the gap between rhetoric and reality. Mr Cashman ORG said which is right in a sense that words are no substitute for real action. Of course words can make a bit of a difference a point that was made by Mrs Malmstr m. She PERSON said that she had received a letter from the Chinese NORP Ambassador a very amiable and highly intelligent representative and servant of his country to tell her that she was wrong and the European Parliament ORG was wrong in its attitude on human rights in China GPE . I think after her speech she will receive a cascade of letters from the Chinese NORP authorities. She will be able to fill a filing cabinet with letters about what is claimed to be the real situation in China GPE . I think she was reflecting the views of many non governmental organisations many people who admire Chinese NORP civilisation but are concerned about what is happening in China GPE today DATE . P Of course it is entirely right that we have to look at action and the very first ORDINAL speech by Mr Salafranca ORG mentioned two CARDINAL issues apart from Geneva GPE which represent actions one of which is of course made possible by the generosity of the European Parliament ORG on behalf of the European NORP taxpayer that is the budget that we are able to spend on human rights activities about EUR 100 million MONEY that is spent through programmes for which I am responsible mainly going to non governmental organisations to promote human rights and to promote democratisation. We will want to share with Parliament ORG as vicars say our views on how that spending programme to support human rights can be best focused and best targeted in the years ahead DATE . P There is also the question which was referred to by Mr Salafranca ORG who I am sorry is unable to be with us at the end of this brief but useful debate. There is also the question of our overall policy on human rights and the relationship between human rights and foreign policy. I want to remind Parliament ORG that the Commission will be publishing before the middle of the year DATE a comprehensive intellectual case for placing human rights at the heart of the development of the common foreign and security policy. It is immensely important and if I had not thought that already having listened to the remarkable speech by Mr Havel earlier in the day I would have certainly come to that conclusion. P It has been a useful debate. I hope we can have further debates like this. I hope we can have in particular debates about some of the ways in which we translate these good intentions into practice on the ground where it matters where people are still being tortured where people are still being raped and are still being denied the sort of civil rights that this House ORG takes for granted as I do. SPEAKER ID 103 CARDINAL NAME President I have received 7 CARDINAL motions for resolution pursuant to Rule 37 2 to close the present statement. P The debate is closed. P The vote will take place on Thursday DATE . CHAPTER ID 9 Cyprus and Malta WORK_OF_ART SPEAKER ID 104 CARDINAL NAME President The next item is the joint debate on P the Council ORG statement on the position of the European Union ORG on developments concerning Cyprus P the report A4 0029 2000 DATE by Mr Brok on behalf of the Committee on Foreign Affairs Human Rights Common Security ORG and Defence Policy on the proposal for a Council ORG regulation on the implementation of operations in the framework of the pre accession strategy for Cyprus and Malta WORK_OF_ART COM 1999 0535 DATE C5 0308 1999 1999 DATE 0199 DATE CNS ORG . P Mr Seixas da Costa PERSON has the floor on behalf of the Council ORG . SPEAKER ID 105 LANGUAGE PT NAME Seixas da Costa PERSON Mr President ladies and gentlemen on behalf of the Presidency of the Council of the European Union ORG I would like to present to you certain information about the re opening of the intra Cyprus negotiations and recent developments in this area. P I think it will be obvious to everyone that the events in Helsinki GPE at the end of last year DATE and the new era in relations between the European Union ORG and Turkey GPE have created a new backdrop at Community level which we cannot ignore when it comes to relations between the two CARDINAL Cypriot NORP communities. P At the beginning of December 1999 DATE the first ORDINAL round of negotiations were held in New York GPE after an interruption of several years DATE in negotiations between the Cypriot NORP communities in the north and south of the island. These negotiations took the form of indirect discussions mediated by the UN ORG special representative lvaro de Soto PERSON . A further round was held in January this year DATE starting on 31 January DATE and a third ORDINAL round is scheduled to start on 23 May DATE in New York GPE . There is a possibility which has not yet been absolutely confirmed that continuous and direct discussions may take place with work continuing until September this year DATE . P These discussions essentially cover four CARDINAL areas security the structure of government territorial adjustments and issues relating to refugees and compensation as a result of the situation following the partition of the island. However agreement has also been reached on the possibility of including other issues and the representative of the northern part of the island Rauf Denktash PERSON has suggested three CARDINAL new topics sovereignty confidence building measures and the issue of lifting the embargo on products from the north of the island. P The discussions held so far have essentially resulted in two CARDINAL developments. The first ORDINAL is the possibility of opening up a direct information channel between the European Union ORG and the north of the island without this necessarily signifying recognition of this part of the island as a legal personality at international level but as a means of facilitating adoption of the acquis communautaire with a view to eventual accession of the whole island if a solution can in the meantime be found to the broader problem of the partition of the island. P The second ORDINAL development which we regard as important is the statement made by the Secretary General of the United Nations ORG at the end of the first day DATE s discussions to the effect that an overall settlement of the situation would involve recognition of the specific situation of the north of the island. This is the position of the Secretary General of the United Nations ORG and it will therefore have to form part of our future analysis. P Certain expectations exist about the third ORDINAL round of negotiations in view of the proposed scenarios being prepared with the involvement of representatives of the United States GPE and the United Kingdom GPE in particular in the areas of security and the constitutional structure which it is envisaged will be presented at this round through the good offices of the representative of the Secretary General of the United Nations ORG . This will take place after the election in the north of the island scheduled for 18 April DATE . P ORG Furthermore the Portuguese NORP Presidency of the European Union ORG has decided following the example of previous presidencies to appoint a representative to establish contacts with the various parties involved in this issue. This representative has already contacted all these parties and has in close cooperation with the representative of the Secretary General of the United Nations ORG been monitoring and assisting with the work of the various rounds. In particular we intend that the European Union ORG should maintain a constant profile on this issue and of course all the more so since Cyprus PRODUCT is a candidate for membership of the European Union ORG with negotiations at a fairly advanced stage. This naturally raises certain expectations and means that the role of the European Union ORG is of some relevance in this context. P The approach that we have been following in these discussions and our participation in them essentially turns on taking advantage of a certain desire to alleviate the tensions that exist based on a conviction which appears to be widely shared that it is necessary to continue to negotiate and that continuing negotiations and maintaining their impetus also give rise to hopes that a definitive solution can be found. P There is also another important aspect which I referred to at the beginning of my statement and this relates to Turkey GPE s role in helping the north of the island to prepare for accession. We believe that it is not only necessary to read the conclusions of the Helsinki European Council ORG with some care and attention but that we should also take advantage of the willingness of the Turkish NORP authorities to help to resolve this situation. P I was able to talk to Prime Minister B lent Ecevit ORG about this issue when I visited Ankara GPE myself and although we are aware of the difficulties and sensitivity associated with Turkey GPE s particular approach to this question I believe that there is a window of opportunity that we must not miss. This window of opportunity involves combining various factors one of which and let us be frank about this is the nature of the relationship between Turkey GPE and the European Union ORG . This is key as regards the future of this issue. P On the other hand we think it is important and this is also linked with the way in which the European Union ORG relates to the heart of this matter that an exchange of information between the Commission ORG and the Cypriots WORK_OF_ART in the north of the island should be encouraged. This would not let me make this quite clear imply any kind of formal recognition. Nevertheless we believe and I think this is also how the Commission sees things that the whole process of approximation with the acquis communautaire with a view to overall integration of the island in the European Union ORG through accession at some point in the future implies involving the communities in the north of the island as soon as possible. It may also give the European Union ORG access to data enabling it to justify accession as part of its efforts to assess accession conditions. P Furthermore this means that we in the Council ORG and I think that Parliament ORG will join us in this should encourage the Commission ORG s involvement in this undertaking. It is essential for us to send the Commission a message of confidence about its role in this area. P Lastly I believe and this is also the presidency s intention that we should continue to cooperate actively with the United Nations ORG given the skilful intelligent and capable way in which the Secretary General and the UN ORG organisation in general have conducted these discussions and in particular the way they have endeavoured to help to harmonise the two CARDINAL parties positions. As I said at the beginning the conclusions of the Helsinki European Council ORG last December DATE have had a visible impact on the way the positions of the various parties to this process have developed. The Nicosia Government ORG has expressed its satisfaction with the Helsinki GPE conclusions which open up the way to accession to the European Union ORG without solving the partition of the island beforehand. Nevertheless I have to say that the same authorities have expressed their concern about the pressure they may come under to resolve the issues raised by partition which will evidently imply some concessions. This is related to developments in the sphere of displaced people and the possibility of a new arrangement regarding displaced people should a different solution be found for the island. P On the other hand the Turkish Cypriots ORG fear and there is no point in trying to conceal this that Turkey GPE s application for membership of the European Union ORG may lead to greater flexibility in Ankara GPE s position on this. I believe that despite the fears that may be felt by the two CARDINAL communities on the island these points which could be viewed in a negative light by the authorities on both sides may in the end justify hopes of an ultimate solution. P It is very clear that this solution will involve one of the most important aspects of relations in this area at present which is the extremely positive trend in relations between Athens GPE and Ankara GPE and the very important part played in these relations by the Greek NORP Foreign Minister Giorgios Papandreou PERSON and the Turkish NORP Foreign Minister Ismail Cem PERSON . We believe that this has created the framework for a positive outcome. As far as we the Council ORG presidency are concerned we will continue to follow these developments very closely and we will certainly cooperate with the Secretary General and his personal representative on this matter. We will make the Community institutions aware of what we are able to do and what is possible in general as regards coordination not just at political level but also as regards what the Commission itself can achieve in terms of its scope for managing the accession process. In particular we will make known the flexibility that both parties have demonstrated on this issue. SPEAKER ID 106 LANGUAGE DE NAME Verheugen Mr President ladies and gentlemen today DATE s debate concerns an issue that is particularly important in two CARDINAL respects. Whilst in the first ORDINAL place our discussion has to do with delivering financial aid to Cyprus and Malta WORK_OF_ART so as to enable them to play a full part in the pre accession strategy it is also concerned in no small way with the peace process in Cyprus LOC and thus with stability and security in the Mediterranean LOC region. P Firstly I would like to say a few words on the financial regulation for Cyprus and Malta WORK_OF_ART which the Commission ORG put forward in October last year DATE . I am exceptionally grateful to Mr Brok the rapporteur the chairman of the Committee on Foreign Affairs ORG for his report which forms an excellent basis for our deliberations today DATE . We need this instrument. It replaces the financial protocols that expired at the end of 1999 DATE . We need these instruments so as to be able to meet our financial commitments under the terms of the development strategy for Malta GPE and Cyprus PRODUCT . P I am very grateful for the fact that Parliament ORG is supporting the Commission in its efforts to adopt the draft regulation as quickly as possible. The Committee on Foreign Affairs ORG and the Committee on Budgets ORG have put forward a series of proposed amendments. The Commission is able to adopt some of them. I would like to comment on two CARDINAL points that I know are very dear to Parliament ORG s heart. P First ORDINAL and foremost we are talking about the financial package itself i.e. how much money do we actually want to spend? The Commission will propose a package of EUR 95 million MONEY . The Council ORG has also agreed on this figure. I am aware that Parliament ORG would like it to be a larger amount and I fully understand why this is so. I can assure you that as the competent Member of the Commission I too would very much like to have more money for this purpose at my disposal. P But it is simply the case that we are unable to achieve consensus for a larger amount at the present time. At the end of the day DATE it is the budgetary authority that must establish the final amount. P The second ORDINAL important issue in this respect relates to the transfer of the financial means under line 7 CARDINAL of the budget. In fact this only appears to be a technical issue. It is very much a political issue. I myself have already said here on another occasion that I consider this to be the right approach. I believe I can safely say notwithstanding the fact that the Commission ORG has not reached a formal decision yet that in principle the Commission is prepared to go along with this suggestion. P However the aforementioned decision cannot be reached via this regulation this can only be done under the terms of the scheduled revision of the Financial Perspective ORG . This regulation which covers the period from 2000 to 2004 affords both applicant countries access to technical and financial support for the implementation of the acquis communautaire for involvement in Community programmes and certain of the Community s institutions and for extending the authority of their administration systems and courts P Of the proposed total amount of EUR 57 million MONEY EUR 57 million CARDINAL are earmarked for Cyprus and EUR 38 million WORK_OF_ART for Malta GPE . In the case of Cyprus PRODUCT the draft regulation also provides for the financing of measures intended to support reconciliation between the two CARDINAL ethnic groups and in fact this accounts for a third ORDINAL of the total amount. P On behalf of the Commission I would like to guarantee that the programming for the funds will take place in accordance with the priorities of the accession partnerships as early as in the course of the next few weeks DATE . P Now just a few brief comments on how the Cyprus PRODUCT question has developed since the European Council ORG in Helsinki ORG . I wholeheartedly endorse the statement Under Secretary of State ORG Mr Seixas da Costa ORG made here on behalf of the Portuguese NORP Presidency. We are cooperating closely and to good effect on this issue. As far as Cyprus PRODUCT is concerned it has always been the Union s contention that the accession negotiations should benefit the efforts being made to find a solution to the political problem. Indeed we always supported this view and I am quite convinced that it is appropriate for the negotiations on the resolution of the political problem to take place under the auspices of the United Nations ORG . And we were always agreed that the solution should continue to have as its aim a bicommunal and bizonal federation. P It is still the European Union ORG s goal to admit a united Cyprus PRODUCT . The European Council ORG in Helsinki GPE reiterated that resolving the political conflict would facilitate the accession of Cyprus to the European Union WORK_OF_ART . Nonetheless as the presidency has just said the Council ORG has made it clear that this is not a pre condition for the conclusion of negotiations. P Should it not have proved possible to find a political solution to the Cyprus PRODUCT question by the time the accession negotiations are concluded then the Council ORG taking all the relevant factors into account will take a decision on whether or not Cyprus should gain admittance DATE to the Union. That is how matters stand on the political front. P P The Helsinki European Council ORG s decision on how relations between the European Union ORG and Turkey GPE are to be framed in future has given the situation considerable impetus. I would emphasise that several political processes are running in tandem here and they are closely linked. P In the first ORDINAL place this is all about the relationship between the EU ORG and Turkey GPE . It also concerns the further development of relations between Greece GPE and Turkey GPE and the peace process in Cyprus PRODUCT . P There has already been talk of the window of opportunity which has presented itself following Helsinki GPE and on account of the d tente between Greece GPE and Turkey GPE . And so what can we do to make use of this window of opportunity as far as Cyprus PRODUCT is concerned? I believe we must adopt an intelligent and cautious approach. If we set about this with too much gusto then we will raise expectations we cannot fulfil and so I favour an intelligent softly softly approach which is sensitive to the needs of the given situation. The first ORDINAL thing we are able and want to do is to step up dialogue and communication between the two CARDINAL communities on Cyprus PRODUCT . That is an ambition that finds favour with our Greek NORP and Turkish NORP partners. P Therefore we want to give the so called bicommunal activities renewed impetus in particular those involving young people. We should also give more attention to making sure that the Turkish NORP Cypriot NORP community is better informed about the Union s aims. I am absolutely convinced that if the people were to have a better understanding of the Treaty in fact a better understanding of what the European Union ORG is all about and what its ambitions are this could help to eliminate fear and prejudice. I will be going to Cyprus PRODUCT in mid March DATE and I aim to do my bit towards convincing both communities of the benefits renewed cooperation will bring. P For our part we have made funds available for this purpose in the new financial regulation. These funds are not inconsiderable. I believe it is very important for us to call upon both sides to at last break free from the shadows of the past and gradually develop a new form of cooperation and ultimately a new way of living together. P The talks held under the auspices of the United Nations ORG took place in New York GPE in December DATE and in Geneva GPE at the beginning of February DATE . They will enter the third ORDINAL and perhaps crucial round in May DATE . Negotiations should certainly continue until such time as a solution is reached or at least until substantial progress has been made on the major issues that the presidency has just highlighted. P What should the Commission ORG s role be in this? It is interesting to observe how all those who are party to this process deem the European Union s role to be of central importance. All the players are seeking contact and cooperation with us. They are well aware that the peace process and the adoption of our common accomplishments are inextricably linked and must not come into conflict with one another. P I have to say that I too prize cooperation with the Secretary General of the United Nations ORG and his Special Representative on this issue extremely highly and can tell you that it is progressing smoothly and in a spirit of trust. P One is therefore right to conclude that the resolution of the Cyprus PRODUCT question has gained renewed impetus since Helsinki ORG . I would not wish to go very much further in my assessment at the present time. The Union s decision to commence accession negotiations and to move them on apace which is intended to act as a catalyst to resolving the political problem still appears to me to be the right course of action. In any case I can see no alternatives to this approach that are even remotely reasonable and therefore it just remains for me to say that the Commission will stick to this line and play its part in attempting to resolve the political problem until the accession negotiations are concluded using the accession negotiations themselves as an important instrument in the resolution of the conflict. SPEAKER ID 107 LANGUAGE DE NAME Brok . DE Mr President I am very grateful for the two CARDINAL announcements and statements that Commissioner Verheugen has already made on the proposal for a Council Regulation on the implementation of ORG measures within the framework of the pre accession strategy. P There is no doubt that we must treat Malta GPE and Cyprus PRODUCT as two CARDINAL candidates that must be accorded the same rights politically and also in terms of the pre accession strategy as the ten other States GPE with whom we have commenced bilateral negotiations. I am sure that no one in this House ORG doubts that it would be extraordinarily helpful in the process if it were to prove possible to find a solution to the Cyprus PRODUCT question and it is also clear that the European Union ORG must play its part here. If the outcome of these negotiations were to be a united Cyprus of the kind outlined by the Commissioner which was in a position to join the European Union ORG then we could count this a huge achievement. P On the other hand we must also make it clear of course that there are other options so as to avoid the possibility of creating something awkward that will ultimately land us in difficulties of the kind that will have us running into obstacles and remove our power to act in the overall enlargement process. P It is already clear from the various options that in the context of the overall enlargement process this will be one of the most delicate issues if not ultimately the most delicate issue which we can perhaps expect to produce the most serious political difficulties. P I also consider it to be extremely important that this pre accession strategy is being pursued in such a way that both communities in Cyprus LOC are already being brought closer together. In comparison with the other applicant countries Cyprus like Malta WORK_OF_ART is a relatively rich country overall but it must still be treated equally in some respects. We should turn this equal treatment of Cyprus PRODUCT to good account so as to prevent the economic and social disparities between the Greek NORP and the Turkish NORP sectors becoming greater still and ultimately reducing the likelihood of unification even further. To my mind that is why this pre accession strategy has a special significance. P Therefore permit me very briefly to raise those points that Parliament ORG deems important. I would like to thank the Commission for having adopted a clear stance with regard to categorisation within Category B7 insofar as it was able to in the previous decision making process. P I hope that the Council ORG will also take the necessary leap and submit these statements for the European Parliament ORG is well aware that this is a political issue. It follows from this that the pre accession strategy will be homogeneous and even handed in its approach and we should also ensure that it is possible to quote total figures up until 2004 DATE so as to guarantee a budget s reliability clarity and veracity in this respect as well. Owing to the manner in which this was handled hitherto it cannot be brought into line with a normal budgetary process. I believe it is important that the European Parliament ORG has made a positive contribution for this year DATE nonetheless because we do not want these countries to be disadvantaged in any way and that is why we were prepared to make the necessary decisions for Budget 2000 but this can really only apply to this year DATE . That is why it is important for the Council ORG Presidency to draw up an appropriate statement in the course of the deliberations over this report which will enable us to transfer this issue to an orderly process so as to end what to my mind is an unnecessary row. P P I fully understand that problems of a mathematical nature may arise on account of Agenda 2000 and the funding that might be at our disposal. I would also like to state quite clearly that we could perhaps even discuss the figure of 130 million CARDINAL that was mentioned in my report. Parliament ORG has also tabled an amendment for tomorrow DATE based on a different amount particularly as these countries are at a relatively advanced stage of development as I said. However these countries must be able to feel secure for the foreseeable future they must know what is actually in store for them and this must also be reflected in the European NORP Parliament ORG s planning ability as part of the budgetary authority. P P Mr President in Office of the Council ORG I know that you are still full of good intentions regarding cooperation with the European Parliament ORG . I hope that the Council ORG as a whole will be of the same mind and that you will be able to give us the right answers to these questions. SPEAKER ID 108 LANGUAGE EL NAME Giannakou Koutsikou PERSON Mr President we have listened to the statements by the Council and the Commission ORG and I would like to make the following observations. P Mr President in Office of the Council ORG I appreciate the sensitivity with which you are addressing the issue and your effort to establish contact with the Turkish NORP Cypriot side but perhaps it would be more clear and more correct if the vocabulary you use did not leave one CARDINAL suspecting that you might be attempting some kind of indirect recognition even though you stressed that this is not the case. P For example I would not refer to the government of Nicosia GPE . It is the Cypriot NORP Government Mr President in Office not the government of Nicosia GPE . That government has proposed a way in which the Turkish NORP Cypriot side can take part and I think it would be right for the Council and the Commission ORG to urge the Turkish NORP Cypriot side to take part institutionally in the framework of the negotiations conducted by the Republic of Cyprus GPE . P On the other hand the way that the issue of the end of the protocols and the pre accession strategy has been addressed so far creates some doubts for us. I cannot understand why the two CARDINAL small countries must be treated differently nor why a clash was necessary between the institutional bodies. Nor can I understand the pressure applied by Parliament ORG to include the funds in Chapter 7 LAW for the pre accession strategy. How can the whole of the European Union ORG treat in this way two CARDINAL small countries situated on its periphery? Not only are they countries which the European Union ORG needs but they are also countries which are fully qualified to operate within the Union and are already considered capable of participating in economic and monetary union. P As the Commissioner said and I agree with him it is a matter of political decision. This is a small political decision which would bring major benefits especially in helping the two CARDINAL communities effectively to constitute one CARDINAL state to achieve effective rapprochement because the two CARDINAL communities were once close and for the Republic of Cyprus GPE genuinely to be rid of occupying forces. SPEAKER ID 109 CARDINAL LANGUAGE FR NAME Poos Mr President we are required under the advisory procedure to debate a proposal for a Council ORG regulation on the implementation of operations within the framework of the pre accession strategy for Cyprus and Malta WORK_OF_ART . This proposal is similar to the proposal submitted for other candidate countries and once it is implemented will replace the financial protocols which have now expired. P Pre accession instruments are designed to provide technical and financial support for efforts by candidate countries to meet the demands of the Community ORG acquis. The Commission ORG s analysis has in fact shown that although classified as high income countries by the World Bank Cyprus and ORG Malta GPE have the same difficulties as the CEECs in transposing Community ORG law due to their lack of administrative and judicial capacity. It was pointed out during the discussion of Mr Brok s PERSON excellent report in committee that both countries can also benefit from the MEDA LOC budget line for horizontal projects of regional interest. I would be grateful if the Commissioner could explicitly confirm that. P As far as Cyprus PRODUCT is concerned part of the technical and financial aid provided for in the instruments will be used to bring the Greek NORP and Turkish NORP communities closer together and solve the problem of the partition of the island once and for all. The declarations made on the Cyprus PRODUCT question by the Council and the Commission ORG were therefore most opportune and I should like to thank the President of the Council and Commissioner Verheugen ORG . P Since 4 July 1990 DATE when Cyprus applied to join the EU ORG the European Parliament ORG has passed numerous resolutions calling for a political solution in accordance with international law and the relevant resolutions of the Security Council of the United Nations ORG . P In April 1999 DATE Parliament ORG again reiterated its position that the accession of Cyprus PRODUCT should benefit the whole island and help towards a political solution but that accession should not be dependent upon such a solution. In other words accession should not be held hostage to a political solution. The two CARDINAL processes are separate processes. P This unequivocal position on the part of the European Parliament ORG gave rise to a certain degree of controversy. We must therefore welcome the fact that the Helsinki European Council ORG put an end to the speculation and stated in its conclusions and I quote that If no settlement has been reached by the completion of accession negotiations the Council ORG s decision on accession will be made without the above being a precondition . P The position is clear and we must now hope that the improved climate surrounding relations between the European Union ORG and Turkey GPE and between Greece GPE and Turkey GPE will bear favourably on the Turkish NORP Cypriot NORP community and that it will withdraw its refusal to send representatives to the accession negotiations. P The presence of these representatives will not prejudge the final political solution in any way whatsoever. On the contrary it will allow the interests of all concerned to be highlighted as and when Cyprus WORK_OF_ART joins the European Union ORG and prepares for a turning point in its history. SPEAKER ID 110 LANGUAGE DA NAME Jensen Mr PERSON President I want to say that I share the other rapporteurs delight at the fact that better opportunities are now to be glimpsed for making further progress in Cyprus in WORK_OF_ART the light of the improvement in relations between Turkey GPE and the EU ORG and between Turkey GPE and Greece GPE . However I also think that we in the EU ORG should be making a constructive contribution. I also think as has already been mentioned that there are certain problems with the financing arrangements which we must solve. There is of course the question of pre accession aid and this belongs in category seven CARDINAL . Last year DATE Parliament ORG made an exception by agreeing that this expenditure should be placed in category four CARDINAL and the two CARDINAL applicant States are not therefore being treated on an equal footing with the applicant States from Central and Eastern Europe LOC as they in fact should be according to the declarations from the Helsinki Summit ORG . Resources should therefore be set aside from category seven CARDINAL where a review of the financial perspectives must be carried out. This is the crux of the matter. The main point is that the money for Cyprus s PRODUCT and Malta GPE s pre accession aid should come from category seven CARDINAL and that there should be a review of the financial perspectives for if the Council ORG does not endorse this view it is in reality acting in conflict with its own decisions in Helsinki GPE in December DATE . With regard to the amount which is quoted in the Brok ORG report EUR 130 million MONEY I also want to say on behalf of the Group of the European NORP Liberal Democrat NORP and Reform Party ORG that we must negotiate our way towards finding a sum of money. The most important thing is that a multi annual programme be guaranteed and in the correct category so that it might be possible to begin making plans where Cyprus and Malta WORK_OF_ART are concerned. SPEAKER ID 111 LANGUAGE ORG IT NAME Frassoni Mr President the Group of the Greens European Free Alliance ORG support the decision adopted by the European Council ORG in Helsinki GPE according to which the resolution of the conflict cannot be a prior condition for the accession of Cyprus to the European Union WORK_OF_ART . P We should continue to exert strong pressure on the Government of Cyprus but one CARDINAL section of the population cannot blackmail the wish of the majority. Besides we have strong doubts as to how representative the government is of that part of the island is. P It is clear that the window of opportunity mentioned by the presidency should be exploited to the full. But we are also convinced that despite improved relations between the Turkish NORP and Greek NORP populations it is not enough. The conflict in Cyprus LOC will only be resolved through improved relations between the two CARDINAL communities with a view to establishing a federation in the we hope not too distant future. P In particular we should be working towards establishing genuine freedom of movement and resolving the problems of demilitarising and disarming the island. P The European Union ORG should be taking a more decisive role that goes further than merely providing financial support although that is important by promoting and guaranteeing reconciliation between the two CARDINAL communities through the setting up of fora PERSON and confidence building programmes. P I must say that Alex Langer PERSON s presence here in the European Parliament ORG is sadly missed. His efforts to build peace should serve as an example to all of us on how peaceful coexistence can be achieved. SPEAKER ID 112 LANGUAGE FR NAME Wurtz Mr President the reference to dialogue between the two CARDINAL Cypriot NORP communities under the aegis of the UNO reminds us of the fact that 26 years DATE after the invasion of the island by the Turkish NORP army nearly 40 CARDINAL of the territory is still occupied by 35 000 QUANTITY soldiers heavy weaponry is still being used and over 50 000 colonists PERSON are still present in total violation of the resolutions by the Security Council of the United Nations ORG on this matter. P What can the European Union ORG do without interfering in internal affairs in Cyprus LOC to promote a fair and viable solution to this drastic problem in a country which has been associated with the European Community ORG for nearly 30 years DATE and which is due to join the Union within the next few years DATE ? P I have listened to the somewhat equivocal talk and silences on the part of the Council ORG which in my view need clarifying. I think that we need first ORDINAL and foremost to bear the main point of reference for any international community in such cases in mind i.e. the resolutions of the United Nations ORG . The Security Council ORG feels that the solution to the Cypriot NORP problem should be sought within the framework of a two CARDINAL zone twin community federation in other words a single state as Mr Verheugen mentioned consisting of two CARDINAL local administrations elected by the two CARDINAL communities. Cyprus should be one sovereign state with a single international personality and single citizenship and this state should be demilitarised. The international community has thus indicated that it rejects any act accomplished by force. P Secondly the European Union ORG stands to gain in my view by minimising the scope for interpretation of the position laid down by the Helsinki European Council ORG . The solution to the Cypriot NORP problem cannot be a precondition to Cyprus s accession to the Union as Mr Poos ORG has reminded us. If it were Turkey GPE would have a sort of right of veto over the accession of Cyprus to the European Union WORK_OF_ART which is of course unacceptable. P Thirdly ORDINAL we must not in turn allow the position taken by the Helsinki European Council ORG to temper our efforts to resolve the Cypriot NORP question before Cyprus PRODUCT joins the Union. From this point of view the other decision taken at Helsinki GPE namely to grant Turkey GPE candidate status gives the Fifteen CARDINAL new responsibilities as well as new possibilities and its dialogue with Ankara GPE can and in my view should include a determination to ensure that Turkey GPE demonstrates a constructive attitude towards dialogue between the two CARDINAL Cypriot NORP communities which respects international law and which will ultimately lead to a united Cyprus PRODUCT and peace in the eastern Mediterranean LOC . SPEAKER ID 113 LANGUAGE NL NAME Belder Mr President there is a general consensus of opinion that financial aid to Cyprus and Malta WORK_OF_ART is important. The big question however is from what budget heading should this aid be financed? P The Council and Commission ORG have suggested deleting the protocols under category 4 CARDINAL . This is in line with the budget order issued by Parliament ORG in December DATE last. The rapporteur is now making reference to this and proposes classing Cyprus and Malta WORK_OF_ART under category 7 CARDINAL . The Committee on Budgetary Control ORG has even suggested postponing approval of the Brok ORG report until the Council ORG agrees to increase the financial ceilings for category 7 CARDINAL . This is an extremely risky strategy. In fact the financial protocols cannot go ahead without a vote in Parliament ORG . Cyprus and Malta GPE will thus become the victims of a political game between the Council and Parliament ORG regarding the height of the ceilings. Moreover what is the real significance of financial ceilings if they are increased for every new action? I would therefore advocate that the EUR 15 million LAW in category 4 CARDINAL be dropped in line with the Commission ORG s proposal. A multiannual budget of the Commission later on in the year DATE may give a decisive answer regarding credits for the coming years DATE . SPEAKER ID 114 CARDINAL NAME Villiers Mr President all over the world work is being done to resolve long standing conflicts and bring together communities divided by history and by old tribal enmities and hatreds. Now is the time to devote our time and energy to aiding Cypriots WORK_OF_ART from both sides of the green line in finding a solution to a conflict which has lasted for far too long. P We all know that special care is needed to ensure that Cyprus PRODUCT is brought successfully into the European Union ORG and the decisions taken at Helsinki GPE give an added dimension to this debate with the acceptance of Turkey GPE as a candidate country. I hope that the decisions taken at Helsinki GPE lead to progress on the Cyprus PRODUCT issue. I hope this signals a new era of hope for Cyprus PRODUCT . I hope that Turkey GPE begins to play a constructive role in the Cyprus PRODUCT issue. I am delighted to hear the words of support from the Council and the Commission ORG for the UN ORG and the work it is doing in encouraging proximity talks between the two CARDINAL communities to encourage reconciliation and the rebuilding of trust between the two CARDINAL communities in Cyprus LOC . I very much welcome the Commission ORG s support for that bizonal bicommunal federal Cyprus WORK_OF_ART for which the UN ORG has campaigned for so long and which both the Greek NORP Cypriot side and the Turkish NORP Cypriot side should be working hard to bring about. I welcome the renewed warmth in relations between the Greek Government ORG and the Turkish Government ORG . I hope that has an encouraging effect on the Cyprus PRODUCT talks. I hope that the accession money available to assist Cyprus PRODUCT is used partly to promote that reconciliation and rebuilding of trust and that both sides of the divided communities in Cyprus accept and use that money in the spirit in which it is given. P We all throughout the European NORP institutions in Parliament the Council and the Commission ORG should be doing our best to aid Cyprus PRODUCT in its quest to reach a peaceful solution which brings together these two CARDINAL communities which have been divided for too many years DATE . SPEAKER ID 115 LANGUAGE DE NAME Rothe Mr President firstly I would like to extend warm thanks to the Council Presidency to the acting President in Office of the Council Mr ORG Seixas da Costa ORG and to Commissioner Verheugen for their statements on Cyprus PRODUCT . I welcome with open arms the fact that both underlined the European Union s desire to try harder to resolve the Cyprus PRODUCT question. P P For we all know that it is unacceptable that this island has been divided since 1974 DATE and that approximately 38 of Cyprus LOC has been occupied by Turkey GPE for more than 26 years DATE . In the past any attempt to resolve the Cyprus PRODUCT question by peaceful means foundered on the entrenched attitude of the Turkish NORP side the Turkish NORP Cypriot leadership that is. But as you yourself made clear we have just entered the year 2000 DATE and may find that we are facing a new situation possibly with new opportunities. P First ORDINAL of all there are the United Nations ORG new activities which have already been mentioned then there are the new activities to be undertaken by the US GPE government and there is clear rapprochement between Turkey GPE and Greece GPE . In particular however as I see it we ought to be able to expect a breakthrough following the Council ORG decisions taken in Helsinki GPE . The Union admitted Turkey GPE to the circle of applicant countries in Helsinki GPE . At the same time it was decided that the accession of Cyprus to the Union WORK_OF_ART would not be made conditional on the resolution of the Cyprus PRODUCT question which as Mr Poos said was actually already the clear position of the Union and also Parliament ORG and this was confirmed in various resolutions. P Therefore Helsinki has left Turkey GPE in no doubt whatsoever as to the fact that it has no right of veto regarding the accession of Cyprus LOC and that the further deepening of its relations with the European Union ORG are closely bound up with the resolution of the Cyprus PRODUCT question. It is therefore very much to be hoped that smart politicians in Ankara GPE will recognise the opportunities that ending the Turkish NORP occupation of Cyprus PRODUCT would also bring for Turkey GPE itself. I sincerely hope that as someone here said this window of opportunity will be opened very wide indeed and that representatives of the Council and of the Commission ORG will continue to work to this end with the Turkish NORP government. Unlike Mrs Frassoni I do not believe that the Cyprus PRODUCT question is just about different communities of people rather it is quite fundamentally about Turkish NORP politics. P I think we can assume that where Cyprus PRODUCT is concerned the EU ORG accession process is irreversible. And we all hope that it will be a united Cyprus that joins. Hence another request for clarification from you Mr President in Office of the Council ORG you have spoken of involvement on the Turkish NORP Cypriot side. Has there been any indication that the Turkish NORP Cypriot side intends to accept the offer made by the Cypriot NORP government or by the European Commission ORG or that it intends to take up this offer to join the talks? P P Secondly I welcome with open arms the fact that this week DATE on the basis of the Brok ORG report and thank you very much for this report Mr Brok we also intend to concern ourselves with the financial aspects of the pre accession strategy for Cyprus and Malta WORK_OF_ART . For it is absolutely crucial that when the financial protocols with Cyprus and WORK_OF_ART Malta GPE expire we make financial aid available for countries to adapt to the acquis communautaire. Both countries are very far from being the poorest of the applicant countries. Nevertheless it is in fact crucial for Malta GPE and Cyprus LOC to make headway on the adaptation front. Cyprus expects to have to spend around EUR 850 million MONEY which corresponds to almost 12 CARDINAL of their own GNP on adaptation activities between 1999 and 2002 DATE . Consequently the Committee on Foreign Affairs Human Rights Common Security ORG and Defence Policy has pronounced itself in favour of increasing the EUR 95 million LAW that has been set aside. And I very much hope that we will genuinely have opportunities to increase this amount. P P As for the Cypriots Greek PRODUCT as well as Turkish Cypriots ORG it is to be hoped that we will be able to pour considerable resources into the planned measures for bicommunal cooperation that Commissioner Verheugen PERSON mentioned earlier so as to achieve the goal of bringing the two CARDINAL ethnic communities together again. My final question to Commissioner Verheugen PERSON is as follows has there been any sign that there is more chance now of bicommunal contact being established on Cyprus PRODUCT than there was at the time of Luxembourg GPE ? There was no chance whatsoever of it happening at that time because Denkta GPE vetoed it. SPEAKER ID 116 LANGUAGE DE NAME Schroedter Mr President Mr President in Office of the Council ORG Commissioner Verheugen the regulation on accession aid is not exactly an advertisement for coherent work on the part of the Commission. Rather the way in which these aid measures have been cobbled together smacks of amateurism to me. This applies both in terms of the substance and the financial aspect. In my view it will hardly enable us to present the accession activities conducted by the Union to the citizens of Cyprus and Malta WORK_OF_ART as evidence of the fact that it is worth their while joining. As Vaclav Havel PERSON rightly said today DATE the European Union ORG will be judged on its political qualities according to what it can do for the individual. As far as the citizens are concerned it is what a regulation can do for them that matters. We will not exactly win any awards with this regulation as far as that is concerned. It is makeshift and contains heteronomous paragraphs which is no way to set a shining example. The quality of an aid package is assessed according to the following criteria is it decentralised is it transparent is it accessible to the citizens and does it work? P Nonetheless as far as the divided island of Cyprus LOC is concerned overall this pre accession strategy is bound up with a major political challenge. In my view it is the task of the European Union ORG to employ all instruments including this one so as to contribute towards resolving the conflict on the island by political means. Both the Commission and the Council ORG have been making very optimistic speeches here today DATE as well. I am delighted that we are all heading in the same direction in this respect. SPEAKER ID 117 LANGUAGE EL NAME Alyssandrakis Mr President in Office of the Council ORG Commissioner the view of the Greek Communist Party ORG is that the main problem of Cyprus LOC is not its accession to the European Union ORG but the occupation of 40 CARDINAL of its territory by Turkey GPE which has continued for 26 years DATE . Regardless of the national origin of each Cypriot NORP the future of the Cypriot NORP people must involve the unity of that small country. The only acceptable solution that guarantees the future that leaves no room for foreign interventions like those that led to all the problems of the last fifty years DATE is a unified and federal Cyprus LAW in accordance with the resolutions of the UN s Security Council ORG . The key to solving the Cyprus PRODUCT problem is in the hands of the Turkish Government ORG which supports and encourages the intransigence of the Turkish NORP Cypriot leader Raouf Denkta PERSON . P For its part the European Union ORG with its hypocritical professions of interest in freedom and human rights has never been moved by the drama of the Cypriot NORP people by the problem of Greek NORP and Turkish Cypriot NORP refugees by the enforced change of the population composition in the north of Cyprus LOC or by the wholesale settlement of colonists PERSON by Turkey GPE in the occupied areas. Even in this Chamber the Council s ORG representative referred to the north of Cyprus LOC and not to the occupied territories LOC . P The recent Helsinki ORG decision to grant Turkey GPE accession country status even though it has made not the slightest concession over the issue of its occupation of Cyprus PRODUCT for example by reducing its military presence there or giving back Ammokhostos PERSON is clearly encouraging Turkey GPE s intransigence. It is not by chance that immediately after Helsinki GPE the Turkish NORP Prime Minister Bulent Ecevit PERSON stated that the Cyprus PRODUCT issue had been resolved in 1974 DATE . Encouraging Turkish intransigence certainly does not help to bring the two CARDINAL communities closer together in the intimate talks under the aegis of the UN ORG Secretary General. P On their course towards accession the people of Cyprus LOC have already lost a great deal but stand to lose even more. The application of the acquis communautaire has created serious problems for the Cypriot NORP economy especially in agriculture. It entails the liquidation of the public sector and it dislocates and destroys the developed system of social solidarity that exists in Cyprus LOC . I am certain therefore that an island such as Malta GPE with its population of 340 000 MONEY cannot accommodate the rigidities of the economic and legal structures of the mainland which has a population a thousand CARDINAL times greater. P Thus when I look at this proposed instrument I do not see a measure to bring two CARDINAL peoples into the fold of Mother Europe LOC . The situation is more akin to a black hole in space sucking in masses so powerfully that not even light escapes. We should not be bribing these island peoples to cooperate in their own destruction giving them money to absorb laws which are as alien to their culture as a black hole is to Mother Earth PERSON . SPEAKER ID 123 LANGUAGE PT NAME Seixas da Costa PERSON . PT Mr President ladies and gentlemen I have listened to your comments very carefully and in particular to the rather emotional comments about Cyprus especially in defence of the present legal situation in Cyprus LOC which the European Union ORG specifically acknowledges by recognising the relevant resolutions of the United Nations Security Council ORG . Mr Wurtz in no way can it be said that the Council ORG is maintaining an ambiguous silence about this issue the Council ORG assumes total responsibility for its interpretation of the situation in Cyprus LOC . Moreover it was this situation and this interpretation which led the Council ORG to take the decision it took in Luxembourg GPE at the end of 1997 DATE when it decided to take the first ORDINAL steps in the accession process for the Republic of Cyprus GPE to join the European Union ORG . P I hope that honourable Members will realise that regardless of the more or less emotional statements made about issues of this kind the day to day reality of international negotiations normally forces governments to adopt a somewhat more flexible stance and when I say governments I mean all governments. In fact we need more emotional statements to remind us that all these issues have a human side. But we also need to be aware that it is by virtue of rational political stances and flexibility in negotiations that we are able to find solutions to the major disputes which have ultimately led to many tragedies in history. P Regardless of who is to blame and we are not here to apportion blame the relevant United Nations ORG resolutions in this area are clear enough I believe that we should take advantage of the opportunities that the new situation is opening up in more of a rational way and less of an emotional one. The European Council ORG in Helsinki GPE had the courage to take certain decisions and I believe that various aspects of these decisions have already recognised the real value of these opportunities which as I said at the beginning of my first ORDINAL speech represent a window of opportunity. We will not achieve concrete results during this stage of negotiations which is a delicate and sensitive phase by exploiting tensions. No we should continue to make progress by working discreetly to support the special representative of the Secretary General of the United Nations ORG with his remit. The European Union ORG s position on this is crystal clear and I do not think it is worthwhile second ORDINAL guessing particular phrases in the Council ORG s conclusions or in any other statement. We do not play at political correctness in this House ORG we are concerned with fairness at international level and with concrete statements on this issue consistently defined by the Council ORG over a period of time and which the European Commission ORG has also followed carefully attentively and pragmatically. P So when we talk now about the need to involve the Northern Cyprus LOC community in exchanges of information particularly with a view to the eventual accession of the Republic of Cyprus GPE to the European Union ORG we need to be aware that we are trying to find practical formulas that will enable us to overcome the obstacles standing in the way of a political solution. We are not trying to deceive anyone and we are in no way trying to use practical solutions to create a model implying political recognition. I believe that over time the Council of the European Union ORG has clearly demonstrated that this is not how it sees this issue. Decisions have been taken by the Council ORG with a great sense of responsibility. We believe that Helsinki GPE was very clear in this respect. The authorities of the Republic of Cyprus GPE itself have clearly recognised that our relations with them regarding their accession to the European Union ORG have been positive. There is no point in second ORDINAL guessing or trying to second ORDINAL guess our intentions. SPEAKER ID 124 CARDINAL LANGUAGE DE NAME Verheugen Mr President ladies and gentlemen I would like to thank you all very much indeed for this debate which all in all I have found to be encouraging and supportive and it has also shown that there is a great deal of support in this House ORG for the policy of the Member States and that of the Commission. However I would be more than pleased to elucidate a few points as requested. P I will turn firstly ORDINAL to matters pertaining to headings 4 CARDINAL and 7. It is quite simple a special heading namely the famous heading 7 CARDINAL was created in Berlin GPE as part of the large Agenda 2000 package for the applicant countries of Eastern and Central Europe ORG which are currently undergoing a process of transformation and for these countries alone. Malta Cyprus ORG and Turkey GPE were not provided for at this stage. Mrs Schroedter PERSON described this as a lack of coherence. She ought perhaps to take some time to ask the erstwhile President in Office of the Council ORG who is not exactly a stranger to you how this presumed lack of coherence has come about. I have had a little to do with this too. P I do not believe this to be the case. The reason for this decision was rather that we wanted to have a special instrument for the Eastern ORG and Central European NORP States which like Malta GPE and Cyprus LOC are involved in the accession process but under different conditions. P Nevertheless I have said that I understand the arguments that people have been putting forward here and the Commission will endeavour to take account of these aspirations but since this is all about Agenda 2000 and the Financial Perspective ORG we will not be able to do this without amending this Financial Perspective ORG . Hitherto this has been out of the question of course. By way of clarification if we transfer it across from heading 4 CARDINAL to heading 7 CARDINAL then this will have no effect on the overall balance of the budget. If we do this then heading 7 would be increased accordingly but heading 4 CARDINAL would be decreased by the same amount. The idea that heading 7 CARDINAL could be added to in this way and heading 4 CARDINAL left alone is not workable. Parliament ORG is no more able than anyone else to spend money that it has not got at least not until we have a printing machine installed in the basement that we can use to print euro notes! P As for the peace process in Cyprus LOC and how it is linked with the accession negotiations I would reiterate that there has always been a direct connection between the two CARDINAL . The Commission ORG and the Council ORG have long endeavoured to encourage the two CARDINAL communities in Cyprus LOC to undertake joint projects. So far as you know this has proved unsuccessful and I have been asked if there have been any signs to the contrary. Mrs Rothe I would put it this way I am convinced that there has been a distinct improvement in the framework conditions for reaching agreements of this kind. I do not have confirmation of this at present and nor do I expect it since we have not yet held direct talks. These will take place at a later date DATE . P The framework conditions have changed in that the Helsinki GPE decisions made a whole range of things possible that were not possible hitherto and above all in that the political strategies employed by the parties concerned have changed beyond recognition. I have always believed that the old line i.e. not to admit Cyprus WORK_OF_ART under any circumstances until the political conflict has been resolved has a weak point in that it does not provide the Turkish NORP community on Cyprus PRODUCT with a convincing incentive to properly involve themselves for with this strategy the Turkish NORP community would not need to do anything but sit back and wait. There would then be no question of Cyprus PRODUCT acceding to the Union. As matters stand Turkey GPE has to take seriously the fact that there is a risk of Cyprus LOC being integrated into the European Union ORG and this would provide opportunities for prosperity and security for the Greek NORP community whilst the Turkish NORP community whose level of prosperity is already far lower would fall even further behind. Therefore it is my firm belief that since Helsinki GPE there has been far greater incentive to link the accession process with the resolution of the conflict. Indeed that was the idea behind it. After only a few weeks DATE Mrs Rothe it is still too early to deliver a verdict on this but in any case I have no grounds for assuming that the new line will fail. As yet we have no grounds for saying that we will actually succeed but one CARDINAL thing I can say quite clearly is that the conditions that need to be in place for us to take a step forwards have improved considerably. P Finally of course the Cyprus PRODUCT question has a role in the discussions with Turkey GPE . I met the Turkish NORP Foreign Minister in Brussels GPE a few weeks ago DATE and naturally I asked if Turkey GPE could take a positive and constructive stance in relation to this issue. I would just make one point we cannot be 100 sure I am not at any rate that one CARDINAL only has to press a button in Ankara GPE to set the wheels in motion in Cyprus LOC . It is very far from being that simple rather we are going to have to make concentrated efforts during talks with both communities to encourage them to reach an understanding. That is what we intend to do the necessary measures and programmes are in place. P I must make it clear to you that we need this financial regulation the one that has yet to be decided on here before we can even get started. The financial regulation is the legal framework we need to tackle the priorities established under the terms of the accession partnerships with Malta GPE and Cyprus PRODUCT . I cannot start anything while there is no regulation in place because I lack the legal basis for doing so. If the lamented lack of coherence should happen to have something to do with this point then I am bound to say that this regulation is a legal framework and nothing more than that. This legal framework is fleshed out in the priorities set by the accession partnerships that were adopted by the Commission ORG and the Council ORG last year DATE and are now being implemented in the corresponding programmes and project management. On the contrary I would say that although many areas of European NORP policy leave something to be desired in terms of coherence in this instance I would claim on behalf of the Commission and the Council ORG that we have developed a very clear transparent and coherent policy. CHAPTER ID 10 Question Time Council ORG SPEAKER ID 131 CARDINAL NAME President The next item is Question Time B5 0009 2000 . We will examine questions to the Council ORG . SPEAKER ID 132 CARDINAL NAME Manuel Medina PERSON Ortega Question No 1 by H 0022 ORG 00 DATE P Subject Controlling ORG access to Community waters for oil tankers In connection with the accident involving the oil tanker ERIKA ORG off the French NORP coast which produced a large oil slick what steps does the Council ORG intend to take to control access to Community waters for tankers flying flags of convenience which do not meet Community ORG safety standards? SPEAKER ID 133 CARDINAL LANGUAGE PT NAME Seixas da Costa PERSON Mr President ladies and gentlemen on 24 January DATE the Council ORG considered the consequences of the accident the previous month DATE involving the oil tanker Erika PERSON . At that time bearing in mind the strength of public feeling about the disastrous consequences of this accident the Council ORG made known its concerns about the safety of oil tankers and the environmental protection that should go hand in hand with it. P The Council ORG was fully aware of issues of this kind and of the need to take additional measures in this field. It emphasised the importance of the Council ORG taking new measures within a Community ORG framework and in the context of its own work with international organisations. P As you know as currently framed Community ORG legislation requires port authorities to carry out inspections on board all foreign vessels including those flying flags of convenience and to detain them if they do not comply with international standards. There is a directive dating from 1995 DATE on this subject. P With regard to the future the Council ORG noted that work within the Commission should shortly lead to the publication of a communication on the safety of oil tankers and of new proposals to strengthen controls together with provisions on the qualifications of inspecting agencies. P There are also plans for a requirement to strengthen the actual structure of oil tankers visiting Community ports. These dossiers will be progressed by the Transport Council ORG and I can therefore assure you on behalf of the Council ORG that we will not fail to give the highest priority to the proposals which there is every indication the Commission is due to present in this area which we regard as being a vital part of environmental protection. This House ORG will of course also be invited to give its views on these proposals given that these are matters subject to the codecision procedure. SPEAKER ID 134 LANGUAGE ES NAME Medina Ortega PERSON I am pleased that the Council ORG is considering this question. The President of the Council ORG comes from a country Portugal GPE which is directly at risk from just this type of situation. If we stretched our imaginations we could envisage a situation where between now and next summer DATE an oil tanker may run aground under similar circumstances off the Algarve wreck the Portuguese NORP summer tourist industry with a bit of luck the sea currents would carry the pollution towards the island of Madeira because they move in that direction and furthermore wreck tourism in the Canary Islands LOC as well. P Of course the story of the Erika PERSON seems comical. A French NORP owned ship under a Maltese NORP flag of convenience an Indian NORP crew a sea worthiness certificate issued by Italy GPE in Sicily GPE with the last inspection carried out in Bulgaria GPE I think. The ship was sinking and the captain realised that it was sinking and that it was not even going to make it to the next port. P This kind of situation should not be allowed.
