P The dramatic changes in Europe LOC since the iron curtain fell ten years ago DATE the increasingly obvious need to enlarge the European Union ORG faster and faster economic integration and the array of new threats being generated by present circumstances are also factors which have forced the European Union ORG to open its mind to renewed more intense introspection and to identify and redefine the values which unite it and give it purpose. P The idea is occasionally mooted that this quest has come too late that cultural and political integration and introspection should have preceded economic integration in other words that we have started from the wrong end. P I do not think that is a fair judgement. After the Second World War EVENT democratic western Europe LOC had to deal with the memory of the horror of two CARDINAL world wars and the threat of the spread of totalitarian Communism. At the time it was almost superfluous to discuss which values needed to be protected. They stuck out a mile. On the contrary the west needed to unite technically as it were post haste in order to prevent the possible emergence or even the proliferation of dictatorship and a relapse into old national conflicts. P Doubtless the same applies to my feeling of Europeanism it came to me so naturally over the years or even the decades that it did not even occur to me to claim it explicitly. For western Europe LOC everything which it needed to protect was so obvious that it did not feel any pressing need to define it analyse it pull it apart or translate it into various political or institutional acts. Thus just as I have only now come to ask myself if I feel European NORP and to consider what that means so the democratic Europe LOC under construction has doubtless been forced by the historic events of the last decade DATE to reflect on the very basis for its unification and its objectives in greater depth. P In my view the main European NORP values as shaped by the turbulent spiritual and political history of Europe LOC and as adopted by other parts of the world or at least some parts of the world are obvious. Respect for the individual and for his freedoms his rights and his dignity the principle of solidarity equality before the law and the rule of law protection of all ethnic minorities democratic institutions separation of the legislative executive and judicial estates political pluralism respect for private property and free enterprise a market economy and the development of the civil society. The form which these values currently assume naturally reflects countless modern European NORP experiences including the fact that our continent is becoming a main multicultural crossroads. P I should like to dwell for reasons which I shall explain on one of these fundamental values. I refer to the civil society. P In the western world i.e. in today DATE s Euro American NORP world a richly constructed open decentralised civil society based on trust in the sovereign independence of its citizens and their various associations forms the basis of the democratic state and guarantees its political stability. P If the European Union ORG is shortly to open its doors to new democracies and in my view it is in its vital interest to do so it is extremely important if not of capital importance that it help to reconstruct and develop the civil society in these countries. It was not by chance that shortly after it came to power the Communist NORP dictatorship shredded and then eradicated the fabric of civil society as quickly as possible. It knew full well that it would never gain real control of the people while the various grass roots structures of the civil society continued to function. What remained of a genuine civil society lived and developed in direct or indirect resistance. And European NORP values survived in this milieu not thanks to the political regime but in spite of it. P The way in which society structures itself cannot of course be imposed from on high. But the climate and the conditions which are conducive to its development can be put in place. P In this sense aid for new democracies should be given in the wider context of the sustainable development and reinforcement of the civil society at pan European NORP level. P The more varied differentiated and interlinked the various civil European NORP structures the more willing the new democracies will be to join them and the faster the principle of trust in the citizens and subsidiarity will apply in them thereby reinforcing their stability. But that is not all the foundations of the European Union ORG as a supranational community will grow all the stronger. P Specifically that means that one CARDINAL of the first ORDINAL jobs is to transfer certain social solidarity tasks to local authorities and non profit making or public sector organisations. The lower the level at which resources are redistributed the more transparent and economic this redistribution will be providing better coverage of the multifarious needs of society which are difficult to define from the centre and creating social solidarity which is all the more genuine for being distinctly linked to specific persons or associations of persons. This genuine solidarity between citizens social groups communities and regions is the best basis for solidarity which cannot be dispensed by a single entity i.e. the state. And in a supranational entity as big as the European Union ORG which needs to function as an instrument of solidarity the real civil foundations must be even more stronger and even richer. The viability of the European Union ORG therefore depends mainly perhaps above all on the spirit in which its citizens accept a civil European NORP identity. P An increasing awareness of all the symptoms or manifestations of national egotism xenophobia or racial intolerance should clearly form part of this new sense of European NORP identity. The policy of appeasement which culminated in the capitulation to evil in Munich GPE is one CARDINAL of the bitterest chapters of modern European NORP history. This experience should encourage us to be vigilant. Evil needs to be nipped in the bud and it is not enough that there are governments to do so. The attitude of governments should be informed by the attitude of its citizens. P P The concern for security is another expression of social solidarity. This is the job of the state or of a supranational grouping. The European Union ORG has started working intensively on a new concept for its security policy. The overriding feature of this policy should be its capacity to take decisions quickly and transform them equally quickly into action. I think that is extremely important. It is also high time. Surely recent experiences in Yugoslavia GPE have a great deal to teach us on this subject. P In my view the intervention by NATO ORG demonstrated several things quite clearly. P First ORDINAL respect for life and human dignity and the concern for European NORP security may under certain circumstances call for intervention beyond the borders of the European Union ORG . Of course the stronger the mandate for such intervention the better. However one can also imagine the unfortunate situation in which there is no UN ORG mandate and yet intervention is in the interest of the whole of Europe LOC and human civilisation as we know it. I am not convinced that Europe LOC was prepared even recently to deal with such a disastrous eventuality. It is certainly more prepared now at least psychologically and I think that it should capitalise on this and finalise its material and technical arrangements. P Secondly ORDINAL more effort needs to be made in the area of preventive security. In Kosovo GPE and Serbia GPE as in Bosnia Herzegovina GPE and other parts of former Yugoslavia GPE tens of thousands CARDINAL of human lives and countless property could have been saved if the international community had been capable of appropriate reaction earlier when the conflict broke out. P Applause Unfortunately despite all the appeals despite all the warnings of possible or imminent atrocity nothing happened. One CARDINAL of the possible conceivable reasons was a preoccupation with a variety of individual and material interests and the inability of government teams to rake risks in the name of a good cause and the greater good. P Thirdly ORDINAL the United States GPE played the leading role in this particular instance and it is highly probable that without their intervention the international community not knowing what to do would today still be witnessing the atrocities which led to intervention in Kosovo GPE . But Europe LOC cannot rely indefinitely on the United States GPE especially when it comes to European NORP problems. It should be capable of finding a solution and resolving the situation itself. It is unthinkable in today DATE s world where small entities legitimately unite in international or supranational communities that the European Union ORG can continue to be a respected member of the world order if it is unable to agree on how to defend human rights not only on its own territory but within its sphere of action i.e. in the area which may one day belong to it. P I think as I said a moment ago that enlargement is in the vital interest of the European Union ORG . Allow me to reiterate and highlight this conviction. P It stems perhaps from the experience of a man who lived for forty years DATE under Communist NORP rule preceded by Nazi NORP domination or from the individual experience of an inhabitant of a country at the very centre of Europe LOC which over the centuries DATE has become the crossroads of various spiritual currents and European NORP geopolitical interests even the birthplace of more than one CARDINAL European NORP conflict. All this leads me to the firm conviction that Europe LOC is the only political entity whose security must be undivided. The idea of two CARDINAL Europes living cheek by jowl the idea of a democratic stable prosperous Europe LOC on the road to integration and a less democratic less stable and less prosperous Europe LOC is in my view completely illusory. It sounds like the idea of sustainable coexistence in a room which is half CARDINAL flooded and half CARDINAL dry. Despite its differences Europe LOC is indivisible and anything serious which happens to it will have repercussions on and consequences for the rest of the continent. P As a single political entity Europe LOC has an opportunity today which it has never had throughout its turbulent history the opportunity to construct a profoundly fair and peaceful order based on the principle of equality and cooperation by all sides. No more acts of violence perpetrated by the powerful on the less powerful instead understanding and general consensus however difficult they are and however long they take to achieve should be the guiding principle behind the structure and stability of Europe LOC in the next millennium DATE . In this context I understand Europe LOC to mean the continent as a whole. P We all know that the process of enlargement of the European Union ORG needs to be accompanied by continual and ambitious reform of its institutions. I am sure that the Intergovernmental Conference ORG will make realistic proposals which will send the European Union ORG in the right direction. However institutional change within the European Union ORG must not stop there. On the contrary it must be the start of a very long process possibly taking several decades DATE in which the overriding concern is to speed up and simplify decision making within the European Union ORG and make it more transparent. P Allow me to mention two CARDINAL more specific points which I have alluded to on several occasions and which could in my view help to achieve these objectives in the more distant future. P First I believe that the European Union ORG should sooner or later have a clear accurate universally understandable constitution... P Applause ... a constitution which every child in Europe LOC can simply learn at school. This constitution would comprise two CARDINAL parts as is standard practice. The first ORDINAL part would set out the fundamental rights and duties of the European NORP citizens and states the fundamental values on which a united Europe LOC is based and the sense and purpose of the European NORP structure. The second ORDINAL would describe the main institutions of the European Union ORG their main powers and the relations between them. The fact of having a constitution would not automatically radically transform the union of states as we know it into the federal superstate which the eurosceptics dread it would simply give the people of the Europe LOC under construction a clearer idea of the nature of the European Union ORG thereby allowing them to understand it better and identify with it. P Applause One CARDINAL of the important questions often rightly raised in connection with institutional reform is how the Union will ensure that the smaller Member States can rest assured that they will not be relegated to a minority by the larger Member States even taking due account of the size of the various states. It seems to me that one CARDINAL possibility might be to create a second ORDINAL chamber in the European Parliament ORG . It would not of course be directly elected instead the various parliaments would send delegations of perhaps three CARDINAL deputies per state. The first chamber i.e. the current parliament would reflect the size of the various Member States while the second ORDINAL would reinforce their equality because all Member States would have the same number of deputies. This would mean that the Commission for example would not need to have one CARDINAL member per state and the national parliaments could be involved in a much more hands on manner. P Whatever the process or outcome of institutional reform or the reform which I mentioned one CARDINAL thing would appear to be certain disagreement or the absence of consensus on institutional issues should not hamper the enlargement of the European Union ORG . Were it to do so too great a delay might have far more dangerous consequences than the failure to complete institutional reform. P Ladies and Gentlemen the technical civilisation which covers the entire planet was born in Europe LOC and has been highly influenced by certain aspects of the Euro American NORP civilisation. P Europe LOC therefore bears a great deal of responsibility for the state of this civilisation. However this responsibility should never take the form of forcibly enforcing its own values ideas or heritage on the rest of the world. On the contrary Europe LOC should at long last get its own act together and serve as an example which others may but are not obliged to follow. P The whole modern perception of life as continual material progress and growth based on the assurances of man who sees himself as the master of the universe is the hidden and regrettable face of the European NORP spiritual tradition. This perception of life also predetermines the threatening side of our current civilisation. Who if not this part of the world should vigorously oppose these threats given that it was this part of the world which started this trend sending our civilisation into free fall? P It seems to me that at this turning point in time it is up to Europe LOC to take a good look at its equivocal contribution to the world and to realise that we have not only taught the world human rights we have also shown it the Holocaust. We were the spiritual mentors not only for the industrial and then the information revolution but also when it came to disfiguring nature in the name of rampant materialism pillaging its resources and polluting its atmosphere. We need to understand that yes we did open the way to huge developments in science and technology but we did so at an exorbitant price by doing away with a whole set of very important and complex human experiences formed over several millennia. P Europe LOC needs to get its own act together first ORDINAL . It can make savings impose hardships respect in the best spiritual tradition the higher cosmic order as something which is above and beyond us and respect the moral order as the consequence of that higher order. Humility affability kindness respect for what we do not understand a deep feeling of solidarity with others respect for what is different the willingness to make sacrifices or do good deeds which eternity alone can reward the eternity which watches us silently through the eyes of our conscience. These are the values which could and should be on the agenda as we construct Europe LOC . P Europe LOC bears all or some of the responsibility for the most horrific events of the 20th century DATE two CARDINAL world wars fascism and the totalitarian Communist NORP regime. P Over the last century DATE Europe LOC witnessed three CARDINAL positive events not all of which were of its doing the end of colonial domination the fall of the iron curtain and the emergence of the European NORP structure. P In my view the fourth ORDINAL major mission which awaits Europe LOC is to try and show by its very existence that it is possible to counter the huge danger which our contradictory civilisation allows to hover over the planet. P I would be happy if my country could take part in all this as a fully paid up partner. P Thank you for your attention. P Long and enthusiastic standing ovation SPEAKER ID 205 CARDINAL NAME President Mr President allow me on behalf of the European Parliament ORG to extend our warmest thanks for the clear message which you have brought and of which the members have already shown their appreciation. Thank you. You are right to remind us that a national identity is perfectly compatible with a European NORP identity. And you have used your personal experience to show us that your European NORP identity was not decreed it was a spontaneous and natural move. I have taken note of your words this is something which we all feel very deeply. P We find you faithful to the principles which have always guided you which have always guided your actions your attachment to fundamental values. You reminded us of your speech in 1994 DATE which you yourself qualify as slightly provocative but there is such a thing as creative utopia and we have been able to gauge together how far we have come. And you very opportunely highlighted the role of the civil society the importance of the civil society not just in the candidate countries but in all the countries in the European Union ORG in restoring our citizens confidence in restoring confidence in the social solidarity which we need. To summarise perhaps what struck me most in your speech above all you wished to remind us that beyond its economic aspects the task of constructing Europe LOC is a spiritual one. We of course look forward most keenly to continuing this task with you. Thank you Mr President. P The formal sitting was closed at 12.40 p.m. TIME CHAPTER ID 13 CARDINAL ACP EU Joint Assembly ORG SPEAKER ID 206 CARDINAL NAME President The next item is the annual DATE report A5 0032 2000 by Mr Corrie on behalf of the Committee on Development and Cooperation ORG on the results of the activities of the ACS EU Joint Assembly in 1999 DATE . SPEAKER ID 207 NAME Corrie rapporteur PERSON . Mr President I had hoped to be rising at 9 a.m. not 9 p.m. TIME to present this report. I hope the number of Members in this Chamber is not an indication of the interest in overseas development work. However it is normal practice that the report on the work of the ACP EU Joint Assembly ORG is put before Members of this Parliament ORG and I have the pleasant task of doing that tonight TIME . P Once again I can report two CARDINAL highly successful Assemblies ORG having taken place one in Strasbourg GPE and one CARDINAL in Nassau GPE . In many ways this was the end of an old era and the start of a new one. The ACP EU Joint Assembly ORG is a unique organisation in world politics. Where else do 86 CARDINAL nations come together to discuss matters of mutual concern? The Strasbourg Assembly ORG was the last chaired by Lord Plumb. In honour of the tremendous work he carried out over a difficult period the Joint Bureau ORG in Nassau made him an honorary president and we wish him well in his retirement. P The two CARDINAL Assemblies have been dominated by the negotiations on renewal of the Lom Convention and I look forward to the signature of a new Convention ORG and its rapid ratification by all the countries concerned. I remember that at the last mid term review when I was rapporteur the then Commissioner Marin PERSON said that review would be the last. Well he was wrong and I pay tribute to Philip Lowe PERSON and his team who have worked so successfully behind the scenes to conclude a new Convention ORG in very difficult circumstances. P I was also delighted to hear the report this morning TIME from Commissioner Nielson PERSON who has worked untiringly to get the right outcome to the negotiations. I pay special tribute to him for his success. I also pay tribute to Mrs Kinnock PERSON and her working group for the huge amount of work they put in on the future of Lom . I am quite sure that Mrs Kinnock PERSON s report and the one on regional cooperation and integration had a major bearing on the outcome of these negotiations. I also thank the Working Groups ORG on the small island states and climate change and the Follow up Group on Fisheries for their excellent reports. We have had question times to the Council and the Commission ORG and to the ACP Council ORG and I would like to thank those institutions for their interest in our work. P The main thrust of our work in both Assemblies was poverty eradication. The resolution passed went so far as to say that poverty amounted to a violation of human rights. It also emphasised the importance of abolishing gender inequalities and as I travel through Africa LOC and see the work done by women I only wish there were more women in senior government positions and in presidential posts. We might then see an end to some of the fraud corruption and mismanagement that seem endemic in some countries and that have to be stopped. P We had as usual many debates on countries where there are war situations. I visited Ethiopia GPE and Eritrea GPE to gain first ORDINAL hand knowledge. The OAU is doing its best to broker a peace deal there. But Ethiopia GPE is still calling for clarification on certain issues and the humanitarian situation in both countries is serious. P We were delighted to hear in Nassau GPE that a trade agreement was being reached with South Africa GPE after four years DATE of negotiations. This highlights the problems of coherence between the EU ORG and the developing nations which came to a head at the WTO ORG talks in Seattle GPE . Much work has to be done to convince the developing nations of the advantages of globalisation and world free trade agreements. P In Nassau we had two CARDINAL interesting debates on East Timor GPE and Cuba GPE . Cuba GPE has observer status but I understand has now shown a wish to join the ACP ORG . All nations from within the confines of the ACP ORG territory who can live up to the requirements of democracy human rights governance and an independent judiciary are I am sure welcome. I await with interest developments in Cuba GPE . When Mr Dalmau the Cuban NORP Junior Minister for Foreign Affairs addressed the Assembly ORG he did not hesitate to let his feelings be known. P On East Timor GPE Mr Da Costa from the Timorese National Resistance Council ORG gave a very moving address indicating that East Timor GPE would also like to join the ACP ORG when it becomes a state with a government. We must give them all our support to reach that goal. Human rights is such an important issue within the ACP EU Assembly ORG that Joint Vice Presidents have been appointed with special responsibilities for monitoring human rights closely and reporting to the Assembly ORG . A number of cases have been highlighted including the child soldier issue in Sudan GPE where many children have been abducted from neighbouring states. P I had the honour of being elected the European NORP Co President at the beginning of this fifth DATE term and Mr Clair from Mauritius ORG is the new ACP Co ORG President. I would like to see a number of changes to our Assembly ORG particularly after the signing of the new Convention ORG in May DATE . We must have more equality between our ACP ORG partners and our European NORP members and I want to get rid of the them and us syndrome. P Firstly I would like to see a Joint Parliamentary Assembly ORG of elected members from ACP ORG countries and not ambassadors or government ministers sitting there as delegates. This I think is the new Convention ORG . Secondly ORDINAL the new Convention ORG allows for regional assemblies in the six CARDINAL regions which would allow us to be much more specific in our work. These assemblies would report back to the Joint Assembly ORG . We had a regional debate in Nassau GPE in the Caribbean LOC and this was extremely productive. We are going to have one in Abuja GPE in West Africa GPE too. I want the Assembly ORG to stop being just a talk shop and become a work shop for the betterment of all the people in developing countries. I want to see civil society given a louder voice. But to do that we have to see an end to corruption and we have to face this head on. We must reward those nations which are making the effort to live by the rules of good governance. Equally we should come down hard on those who are corrupt or whose constitutions do not allow the pluralist governments that we demand. I am delighted to see the result in Zimbabwe GPE . P European NORP taxpayers will no longer accept their taxes being fraudulently used. A new wind of change must blow through Africa LOC and new standards must be set and lived up to. The Joint Assembly ORG should play a leading role in monitoring the enactment of good governance human rights and democracy in cooperation with the Commission. I believe that as equal partners the EU ORG and ACP ORG elected delegates are up to that task. I beg to move acceptance of this report. P SPEAKER ID 208 LANGUAGE DE NAME Zimmerling Mr President let me begin by congratulating Mr Corrie PRODUCT on his excellent and comprehensive report. Our approach to development policy must always be based on respect for human rights and the fight against poverty. But there is a crass contradiction between fighting poverty and the cuts in development aid appropriations in many Member States and in the EU ORG . With regard to financing we must look to the future and provide the Joint Assembly ORG with additional funds so that for instance we can send delegations to the ACP ORG states to oversee electoral processes at their invitation. In future the EU ORG must take a far more multilateral approach when it agrees development projects and furthermore must coordinate more closely with the individual states in order to improve efficiency and use the funding more effectively. P An example here could be the field of education which will deserve and need special support in the ACP ORG states in future. For instance the very rapidly growing educational and technological potential of the Internet offers entirely new means of helping the developing countries which at present still have modest resources to move towards a global approach as opposed to globalisation. I see it as a future task of the EU ORG to contribute in this way to the establishment of small and medium sized enterprises in the ACP ORG states which can promote self help. An example here is the problem in Nigeria GPE which imports industrial finished products from all over the world and then has to spend substantial resources on product maintenance by foreign workers. P One CARDINAL way forward to promote the setting up of SMEs could be to train the Nigerian NORP population adequately. It will be easier to take account of the developing countries very diverse problems and EU ORG aid could be prepared and implemented in a more targeted manner if as the report makes quite clear we take the urgently needed step of optimising our working methods by introducing the proposed regional assemblies. SPEAKER ID 209 CARDINAL NAME President Thank you Mr Zimmerling If I am informed correctly this is the first ORDINAL time you are addressing this House ORG . Congratulations on your maiden speech It went really well. SPEAKER ID 210 LANGUAGE DE NAME Junker Mr PERSON President it cannot be repeated often enough since 1975 DATE the Lom Convention EVENT has constituted an important pillar of European NORP development cooperation and has a pilot role to play in many respects. Based as it is on the principle of partnership and equality and on parliamentary control by the Joint Assembly ORG it is an example to the world. Most appropriately given that this year DATE we are celebrating 25 years DATE of cooperation under Lom PERSON we will shortly be signing a new and more advanced partnership agreement which also upgrades the Joint Assembly ORG into a genuine parliamentary assembly on both sides. P So I do not want to look back only to the year 1999 DATE . The rapporteur Mr Corrie PRODUCT has already done so most expertly. Much of what concerns us today DATE is the outcome of fundamental processes of transformation in all parts of the world since the late 1980s DATE . They also had strong repercussions in the developing countries. The after shocks can still be felt. ACP ORG cooperation is a dynamic process. The content of the agreements has progressed steadily between Lom I and Lom VI. At the same time the number of partner states has increased considerably now standing at 71 DATE . All those involved were particularly moved by the enlargement to Namibia GPE and South Africa GPE . P Cuba GPE has just knocked at the door and if Cuba GPE is also accepted into the ACP ORG EU community that will be a momentous step and will bring in its wake processes of change in Cuba GPE itself. So ACP ORG cooperation remains very exciting and not only because of the new emphases introduced in the new Convention ORG . Fighting poverty and promoting sustained economic cultural and social development are important objectives in the endeavour to build up democratic societies based on respect for human rights in the ACP ORG states. That also means strengthening the democratic institutions. P The history of the Joint Assembly ORG provides impressive evidence of a positive trend in that direction. In the past the representatives of the ACP ORG countries tended to be government members government officials or ambassadors but today DATE at least three quarters DATE of the ACP ORG delegates are elected members of parliament ORG . We ought to throw a big party when the figure reaches 100 CARDINAL in the near future which is indeed what the new Convention ORG is aiming at. P Unfortunately there is far too little appreciation of the steady advance of processes of democratisation which unlike the various crises that arise largely pass unnoticed. One CARDINAL special aspect of multilateral cooperation with the ACP ORG states is regional cooperation and integration. P There is one wish on the European NORP Parliament ORG s long wish list that will be fulfilled as we have already heard the Joint Assembly ORG will soon also be able to hold regional assemblies. Enhanced regional cooperation can help prevent the outbreak of conflicts based on ethnic economic social or religious factors i.e. have a preventive effect. For the same reason the European Parliament ORG has always called for civil society to be involved in the decision making processes and in cooperation management and emphasised the importance of decentralised cooperation. P The enhanced contacts between the Joint Assembly ORG and the social partners provided for in the new Convention ORG are another step in the right direction. But I am a little sad that the European Development Fund ORG has still not been incorporated in the Community ORG budget. I hope it does not take another 25 years DATE before we finally achieve that too. SPEAKER ID 211 CARDINAL NAME Lucas Mr President I congratulate Mr Corrie PRODUCT on his report. The Lom Convention WORK_OF_ART has been an expression of a real partnership between the EU ORG and the ACP ORG countries for over 25 years DATE . That it has continued at all in the face of overwhelming pressure against it from many quarters including the WTO ORG is a triumph of sorts. But of course the new Convention ORG must be measured not by the fact that it exists but by the extent to which it can contribute to the EU ORG commitment to poverty eradication and the achievement of the international development targets. Measured by this yardstick there are a number of serious shortcomings in the new arrangements. For example the agreement is particularly disappointing for those ACP ORG countries suffering from short term fluctuations in export earnings. P During a marathon negotiating session in December DATE a compromise was reached which provided that in respect of least developed landlocked and island states assistance would be provided in the event of a minimum 2 CARDINAL loss of export earnings rather than the level of 10 CARDINAL for the other ACP ORG states. But at the final negotiating session the EU ORG claimed that it had never actually agreed to the inclusion of islands and landlocked states among those which would qualify for the support on the basis of the 2 CARDINAL threshold. P This change has been devastating for the Windward Islands LOC in particular which may be the only ACP ORG state which will actually lose massively from the new arrangements. This seems a particularly perverse outcome since the Windward Islands LOC are one of the smallest and most vulnerable of the ACP ORG states and they are now going to have to pay the highest price for this new Lom arrangement. P Meanwhile on the trade side pressure from the WTO ORG to ensure that any Lom Convention is WTO ORG compatible has meant that there is a huge momentum behind the idea of the so called regional economic partnership arrangements or free trade agreements. Non least developed countries are likely to face considerable pressure to accept these arrangements. Yet it is quite clear that even after a transitional period a number of countries will simply be unable to open their markets yet to the chill winds of free trade without wrecking their own domestic economy. We therefore need to be particularly vigilant to ensure that genuine options are open to those countries which are not yet ready for free trade arrangements. We need to ensure that strategies for promoting regional integration within the ACP ORG are pursued in their own right. P Finally during any new trade round the EU ORG and the ACP ORG states should press jointly for a reform of GATT ORG Article 24 LAW in order to explicitly provide regional non reciprocal trade agreements between structurally and economically dissimilar groups of countries. P The Lom Convention WORK_OF_ART is a unique partnership but if it is to be truly effective it needs to extend beyond the discussions within the context of Lom and involve a participation of the WTO ORG and a partnership in all other international negotiating fora. SPEAKER ID 212 LANGUAGE FR NAME Laguiller Mr President what I want to do in this debate is condemn the fate reserved for the poor countries of Africa LOC the Caribbean LOC and the Pacific LOC . People have the gall to say they benefit from the Lom Convention EVENT but even looking at trading relations alone the Lom Convention ORG has done nothing to protect those countries their already feeble share in trade with Europe LOC has been halved. That reflects the growth of inequality between EU ORG and ACP ORG countries. The Lom Convention EVENT essentially benefits a few large industrial or financial conglomerates which continue to pillage those countries and perpetuate their economic dependence notably on the former colonial powers. P When it comes to so called development aid given that underdevelopment in the majority of these countries is getting worse rather than better development is clearly not what the aid is for even when it is not just a disguised export subsidy for European NORP manufacturers. The aid is primarily a windfall for incumbent regimes and the poor majority does not benefit at all. P Even if it were properly redirected this aid would not be enough to finance the most basic infrastructure for health care education or drinking water supply. For some years DATE now the great powers have been reducing the amount of this already derisory aid and it is the height of cynicism when this is done on the pretext of human rights violations or corruption. After all who protects these deeply corrupt regimes if not the governments of the rich countries? They turn a blind eye to the masters of corruption the big groups controlling oil water supply or public works. They could clamp down on them since their head offices are here in Europe LOC . P The debate about either extending the Lom Convention EVENT with its quotas and protectionism or instead gradually winding down the special relationship between the European Union ORG and the ACP ORG countries in the name of free trade is a warped debate between two CARDINAL ways of perpetuating the pillage and impoverishment of those countries. I protest against an ignoble and inhuman organisation which literally condemns hundreds of millions MONEY of human beings to a wretched death to enrich a minority. A mere fraction of the fantastic wealth accumulated by the big groups could lift these poor countries out of extreme poverty but until we have the courage to take on those big capitalist groups we are just covering up the real problems. SPEAKER ID 213 LANGUAGE CARDINAL IT NAME Gemelli Mr President I want to thank the Co President of the Joint ACP EU Assembly Mr Corrie PRODUCT . It was no easy task to draw up a report on a complicated forum like the ACP EU Assembly ORG . P In this speech I will confine myself to addressing certain points I consider fundamental. I believe the European Parliament ORG should call for the Assembly ORG to become truly parliamentary urging all ACP ORG countries to send members of their national parliaments as their representatives so as to strengthen their own democratic fabric. P My next contribution to the debate is to turn my attention to globalisation and the WTO ORG which is seen by the ACP ORG countries as an enormous danger to their development. I do believe the ACP ORG countries need a transition period but they also need support in the context of the new logic of regionalisation of aid not only in agriculture and fisheries but also in the exploitation of mineral and underground resources some of which are being exploited with slim economic returns to the ACP ORG countries themselves. P Thirdly the European Parliament ORG through a joint working group within the Joint Assembly ORG must make a major effort to achieve stability in ACP ORG countries budgets through the selection of budgetary items to permit economic and above all social development and by monitoring income and fiscal policies in force in the ACP ORG countries. We must put the people of the ACP ORG countries first ORDINAL in our relationship with their rulers who need to be fully aware that development aid from the European Union ORG is intended for the people and not for the oligarchies that handle all the internal and external resources in some countries. P Fourthly ORDINAL and finally the prevention of inter ethnic conflicts between States GPE must be our constant concern and to some extent this can be achieved either through a strong and authoritative diplomatic offensive or with the proposals I have set out. SPEAKER ID 214 LANGUAGE ES NAME Mart nez Mart nez Mr President I agree with the positive evaluation Mrs Junker PERSON has just made and I want to add that Mr Corrie PRODUCT has started his term as Co President of the ACP EU Joint Assembly ORG with effective and impartial work deserving of our full appreciation. P I shall restrict my speech to one CARDINAL particular act which took place a few days ago DATE partly as a consequence of events alluded to in the report we are debating here. I refer to Cuba GPE s expression of intent of 2 February DATE to become a full member of the ACP ORG group of countries. P A Cuban NORP delegation attended the last meeting of the ACP EU Joint Assembly ORG in Nassau GPE and Vice Chancellor Dalmau PERSON spoke in the plenary session engaging in a lively debate and afterwards held conversations with many of us. Following Nassau a delegation from Parliament ORG led by Mr Corrie PRODUCT and the Chairman of the Committee on Development and Cooperation Joaqu n Miranda ORG visited Havana GPE and a series of very illuminating exchanges of opinion took place. P It is my impression that this mission from the European Parliament ORG was the final push which convinced our Cuban NORP friends that the time had come to move forward on mechanisms of cooperation with the European Union ORG . P We are witnessing events of great political significance and I hope that we in the European Parliament ORG can promote the appropriate favourable view and a generous attitude on the part of the Union so that Cuba GPE s aspirations can meet with a positive response as soon as possible. That is important for at least three CARDINAL reasons. First ORDINAL it is important for Cuba GPE to bring its people development and prosperity and finally break the United States GPE blockade which has been repeatedly condemned by the European Parliament ORG and the United Nations ORG . Secondly ORDINAL we must bear in mind that Cuba GPE s application has the support of all the ACP ORG countries. If the European Union ORG responds positively to the recommendation of our associates we will be proving our respect and consideration for those associates and this will have positive effects on the whole framework of our cooperation with them. Nor can we ignore the value of such a decision in demonstrating the consistency and autonomy of the European Union ORG and the fact that it does not bow to pressure from any quarter DATE . By accepting Cuba GPE into the ACP ORG community we will be demonstrating that our Europe LOC is not involved in the shameful process of playing but not paying and that when we get indignant about absurdities like the Helms Burton Act we are not being hypocritical but are ready to act and take all the consequences. P The ACP EU Joint Assembly ORG meets again in a few weeks DATE time and I am sure this subject will be dealt with there. Ideally the European Parliament ORG s representatives should be able to support Cuba GPE s intent at those proceedings as our parliamentary colleagues from the ACP ORG countries will no doubt be doing. Of course Cuba GPE must meet all the standard conditions just like any other member. The Cubans NORP know that and I am sure they accept it. It must also be made clear that Cuba GPE is not going to be asked for more than has been asked of our other partners. P Cuba GPE s wish to join is welcome and Cuba GPE will be welcome in our circle. I say that wholeheartedly but also with the deep conviction that just as the blockade has produced nothing but poverty and as a consequence of that extreme tension and a hardening of the Cuban NORP position the integration we are supporting here and the prosperity it will produce will translate into the d tente and openness we all seek and from which all of us especially the Cuban NORP people will benefit. SPEAKER ID 215 LANGUAGE SV NAME Sch rling Mr President I also want to begin by thanking and congratulating the rapporteur Mr Corrie PRODUCT for an excellent report which I think very well describes and summarises the work which has been done in the ACP EU Joint Assembly ORG in the course of 1999 DATE . I do not have very long in which to speak and I really only want to take up two CARDINAL questions. P The first ORDINAL is about the fight against poverty which I think is becoming an embarrassment both for the EU ORG and the Member States GPE . In spite of the fact that both in the Treaty and at the UN ORG s meetings in Rio ORG and Copenhagen ORG there was an undertaking to work to eradicate poverty in the world the budget for development aid is in actual fact being cut back when the express desire was that exactly the opposite should happen. We must put a stop to this trend. We must begin by writing off debts. We must follow up words with action. I should like us to take a leading role in this work. P My second ORDINAL question concerns the fact that in many contexts we talk about the ACP ORG countries having to learn the principles of democracy. Paragraphs 2 CARDINAL and 3 CARDINAL of the resolution demand within the context of the new agreement that working methods should be developed and optimised. The ACP ORG countries are to be urged to allow a whole range of political opinions to come up for discussion. I think that is a very good idea indeed and I fully subscribe to it. However we must also ask ourselves about our own democratic arrangements. How do these operate within the European NORP Parliament ORG s delegation to the ACP ORG EU s Joint Assembly ORG ? In contrast to how things are done here in the European Parliament ORG and in Parliament ORG s committees where rapporteurs are nominated and appointed to produce reports there are no regulations whatsoever applied within this delegation to the Joint Assembly ORG . The two CARDINAL large groups share all the reports and consultative documents etc between themselves. In order to change this undemocratic arrangement we the Group of the Greens European Free Alliance ORG have tabled Amendment No 6 in which we request that the rapporteurs appointed to produce reports and consultative documents together with the members of working parties should be appointed in accordance with clear democratic rules. In this context account ought to be taken of the smaller groups and consideration given to introducing more representative arrangements. SPEAKER ID 216 LANGUAGE FR NAME Fruteau Mr President Commissioner firstly I too would like to congratulate Mr Corrie PRODUCT on the quality of his report which appropriately reflects the tenor of the debates in the Joint Assembly ORG he so effectively co chaired. P The eradication of poverty was central to our work and many speakers highlighted the need to preserve an essential tool for achieving that ambitious aim to whit preferential agreements between the European Union ORG and the ACP ORG countries within the framework of the Lom Conventions. The challenge was immense. Globalisation free trade and the hegemony of the WTO ORG with its internationalist philosophy were imperilling the very essence of the North South LOC dialogue. So we can only applaud the conclusion of a new partnership agreement for development and personally I am convinced that the work of the last Joint Assembly ORG did have a decisive influence on breaking the deadlock in the negotiations as did the new climate created by the events at Seattle GPE . P However while I welcome the renewal of the agreements what I find most interesting is the new wind blowing through our relationships and finding expression in the balanced nature of the negotiations now drawing to a close. The European Union ORG seems to me to have finally emerged from the old paternalist or frankly neo colonialist logic where those giving aid are all too eager to start giving lessons following a formula our friend Michel Rocard PERSON is so keen on. The Union has finally accepted the idea that dialogue cannot be genuine or effective unless it is the expression of a contract which respects the dignity of the partners. P By refusing to allow the idea of good governance to become a tool in the hands of technocrats for imposing new sets of conditions the European Union ORG is demonstrating wisdom and modesty. We have spent two centuries DATE laying the foundations of a democracy whose fragility is constantly brought home to us by events. What right have we to try to impose our model on people whose history values and identity are sometimes so profoundly different from our own? P Personally I prefer the willingness that is clearly flagged up in these agreements to extend the partnership to new agents local authorities non governmental organisations which seems to me to represent the only possible way the people of these countries can progressively achieve ownership cooperation. In short this is the only way they can emerge from humiliating and childlike dependence on aid and take responsibility for themselves the proof of success. SPEAKER ID 217 LANGUAGE PT NAME Vairinhos Mr President Commissioner firstly I too would like to congratulate Mr Corrie PRODUCT on the accuracy and rigour of the summary in his report. The European Parliament ORG s opinion on the activities of the ACP European Union Joint Assembly ORG has always had a major impact undeniably contributing to a consistent policy and role for the European Union ORG in development and cooperation. The important role of the increasingly parliamentary Joint Assembly ORG in strengthening relations between the European Union ORG and the ACP ORG countries needs to be stressed. In view of this positive action there is every advantage to be gained from according the Joint Assembly ORG a budget compatible with improving the quality of its work. We back the rapporteur s proposal to introduce regional parliamentary assemblies under the aegis of the Joint Assembly ORG in the six CARDINAL regions of the Convention the Caribbean the Pacific ORG and four CARDINAL African NORP regions. These regional assemblies would monitor action in their respective areas. P Poverty has been the common denominator of all the debates in the Joint Assembly ORG and its eradication is the priority for the European Union ORG s development policy. In line with the resolution at the Nassau NORP meeting we must concentrate on meeting the poverty reduction targets agreed by the international community. Consistency and action are needed. P The next Lom Convention must specify the investment in education and stimulate regional cooperation and the participation of local bodies. The participation of local bodies is absolutely essential. In a wider context the priorities as I see it are to convert poor countries debt into programmes for poverty eradication and sustainable development as well as control of fraud and corruption. We need to make progress with concrete and consistent action. People in the poor countries are beginning to despair. P I call on the Commission to act on the rapid accession of East Timor GPE to the Lom Convention EVENT as one means amongst others of promoting the eradication of poverty and accelerating its economic cultural and social development in order to strengthen its internal democratisation. P Finally I must congratulate the Council Presidency on the coming ORG Europe Africa Summit LOC and call on all the participants to contribute to solid practical action to promote the development of peace democracy and the eradication of poverty in the underdeveloped countries of Africa LOC . SPEAKER ID 218 CARDINAL LANGUAGE DA NAME Nielson PERSON . DA Mr President I should like to take this opportunity to thank the rapporteur for his excellent report and also to thank the Joint Assembly ORG for its work in 1999 DATE . I am also delighted to be able to confirm that I shall be participating in the Joint Assembly ORG s next meeting which takes place in March DATE in Nigeria GPE . The Commission ORG is pleased to see the Joint Assembly ORG playing a larger role especially in connection with promoting a more extensive political dialogue with our partners in development. The Commission agrees with the rapporteur that combating poverty continues to be the central objective for development policy and will always play a key role. In order to be able to develop the countries concerned must however become actively involved in the global economic system. With regard to trade with our partners in development the Commission is quite prepared to guarantee that any new arrangement will take account of the ACP ORG countries special economic and social limitations. Mrs Lucas PERSON mentioned that the Stabex and Sysmin ORG system ought to be continued with. I do not agree. That system has proved itself to be inappropriate because it is in actual fact of use only to relatively few of the 71 CARDINAL countries concerned. It operates too slowly and it therefore stands to reason that the developing countries should have said yes to the new system of the future because this will operate more flexibly. P Regarding the future accession of countries such as East Timor GPE to the Lom Convention I ORG can only repeat what I recently said to the European Parliament s Committee on Development and Cooperation ORG namely that the door is open. It is the applicants themselves who are to decide whether they want to knock on the door. Once they have done so we shall adopt a position on the matter. With regard to Cuba GPE s application for accession to the Lom Convention the Commission ORG notes that according to their recent declaration the ACP States ORG support Cuba GPE s application. The EU ORG has always called for a constructive attitude to be adopted towards Cuba GPE as outlined in the EU ORG s common position but it has to be recognised that the discussions will be complex. With regard to the C te d Ivoire I can inform you that the whole of the EUR 28 million LAW has been paid back in accordance with what was agreed following examination of the financial irregularities. With regard to financing the European Development Fund ORG by an amount in excess of the budget I can say that this is being considered. For its part the Commission supports this but we cannot at this point produce new reports on the whys and wherefores. P Concerning Article 366A I can say that during the negotiations for a new partnership agreement a new procedure was established for dealing with instances where human rights and the principles of democracy and the rule of law are infringed. It is now the case following adoption of the Amsterdam Treaty ORG that Parliament ORG wishes on the basis of Article 300 LAW to be kept fully informed of all decisions and the Commission will continue to take account of Parliament ORG s decisions on this subject. There are no plans to follow the procedure involving concurrent statements in Parliament ORG in connection with such decisions. This would in fact demand a change to the recently adopted Amsterdam Treaty ORG . P Finally I would refer to the South Africa GPE agreement which the rapporteur also touched upon. In this regard I am simply pleased delighted in fact here this evening TIME as a conclusion to this debate to be able very appropriately to inform you that South Africa GPE s President has today DATE said yes to the solution which the EU ORG s Council of Foreign Ministers ORG last Monday DATE agreed unanimously to propose with regard to the outstanding problems regarding South Africa GPE . So the Grappa War EVENT is over. Peace has broken out and we can now look forward to cooperation with South Africa GPE in accordance with the common dreams and values which ought to have underpinned the whole business from the start. I think this rather nicely puts the finishing touches to a debate which has on the whole been quite positive and I would repeat my thanks to the rapporteur and to Parliament ORG for the cooperation which has gone into our relations with the Third World on precisely the work in question. SPEAKER ID 219 CARDINAL NAME President Thank you Commissioner. P The debate is closed. P The vote will take place tomorrow DATE at 12 p.m. CHAPTER ID 14 Stabilisation and association agreement with FYROM SPEAKER ID 220 CARDINAL NAME President The next item is the report A5 0031 2000 DATE by Mr Swoboda PERSON on behalf of the Committee on Foreign Affairs Human Rights Common Security ORG and Defence Policy on the recommendation for a Council Decision ORG authorising the Commission ORG to negotiate a Stabilisation and Association Agreement with FYROM SEC 1999 1279 DATE C5 0166 1999 1999 2121 EVENT COS ORG . SPEAKER ID 221 CARDINAL LANGUAGE DE NAME Swoboda Mr PERSON President Commissioner Patten PERSON today DATE we are discussing a country that really has suffered hard times a country that is however moving in a very promising direction thanks to its own efforts and resolve and certainly also thanks to the support of the international community. So if the European Union the Council and the Commission ORG are proposing and I assume that Parliament ORG will support that proposal tomorrow DATE the first ORDINAL stabilisation and association agreement in south eastern Europe LOC in the Balkan NORP region I am quite happy to use that term it is primarily in gratitude for or acknowledgement of the fact that FYROM itself has worked its way into a good position in economic and of course mainly in political terms in face of the war in the neighbouring region and also in relation to its own minority. For it is no small thing to have a minority of 33 or even 35 CARDINAL in one CARDINAL s own country. That country and its politicians no doubt with some differences here and there have always done very good work and we should recognise that. P The Commission is proposing that we should conclude an agreement jointly with the Council ORG . Let me make a few comments on aspects on which views may differ somewhat although even in this regard I want to strongly emphasise and acknowledge Commissioner Patten PERSON s activities and interest in relation to FYROM and the region as a whole. P Firstly there is the regional approach. I believe that if it is understood properly the regional approach is both important and necessary. There has to be a willingness to cooperate. Provided it is not seen as some kind of constraint but as a willingness to cooperate as an opportunity that each country should grasp then this is the right approach. The problem is that when we look at FYROM we can see how very difficult it is to cooperate economically with some neighbouring countries such as Kosovo GPE and Albania GPE or to cooperate politically with for instance Yugoslavia GPE . On the other hand cooperation with Bulgaria GPE and in particular with Greece GPE has made good progress and I think we should acknowledge that too. P In this context the European Union ORG must consider as it began to do early this week DATE how to include the neighbouring Yugoslavia GPE in regional cooperation in spite of everything i.e. without taking back any of our criticism of this terrible regime. Tomorrow DATE morning I will therefore table an amendment urging that we concentrate the sanctions on the regime itself while easing them somewhat for the people and for the economy in a spirit of economic cooperation. P In that regard allow me to say since I come from a country through which the Danube flows that I am grateful that the Commission i.e. Commissioner Patten PERSON and also Vice President Palacio PERSON with whom I was recently in Budapest GPE is considering opening the Danube ORG to shipping again. That would provide for a modicum of economic recovery in this region too which of course would be of particular importance to Romania GPE . P In my view this regional approach provided it is understood correctly i.e. as a method of contributing to economic recovery in the region itself is in fact the right one to adopt. As I said it must not be perceived as a constraint nor must it be set as a precondition. P Secondly let me say quite clearly and plainly that we want to open the way to and offer FYROM accession to the European Union ORG . In our view it would be an illusion to think there was any point in FYROM applying for accession right now but it would also be wrong to delay discussing it until some later date DATE . FYROM wants to be told here and now that in principle accession will be possible when the time is right. This country is afraid it will be in a sense sidelined. It sees in the whole readjustment of aid instruments a risk that it will no longer be the last carriage of a train heading towards Europe LOC but that this train will continue through Europe LOC while leaving FYROM on a siding. I think Commissioner Patten PERSON understands that too. So I very strongly urge him to make it clear in the appropriate talks. P Thirdly ORDINAL I believe that so far at least FYROM has shown that it is capable of using the various instruments properly. Even though there will of course be readjustments here FYROM will continue to show that many of the tasks that are still being dealt with in Brussels GPE today DATE can in future be handled in Skopje ORG in the country itself. I hope that the honourable Members will agree to support these proposals as a sign of goodwill towards FYROM. SPEAKER ID 222 CARDINAL LANGUAGE NL NAME Oostlander Mr President since the start of the Yugoslav NORP wars the Republic of Macedonia GPE I prefer to use this abbreviation has behaved as a constructive peace keeper. We would remind you of the proposals made by the governments of Macedonia GPE and Bosnia and Herzegovina GPE at the time which had non violent liberalisation and a non violent separation from the Yugoslav NORP federal structure in view. P As you can see our Macedonian NORP friends have always played a very positive role and it is for this reason that it should be pointed out at this stage that Macedonia GPE is not just a pawn in our so called strive towards stability but actually took the initiative. The former President Mr Gligorov can take special credit for this and the current President too has already adopted the profile of President of all Macedonian NORP citizens so much so that the European Union ORG should only be grateful to have him as interlocutor in the Balkans LOC . P Despite the obvious reasons for any internal tension both population groups have struck a reasonable modus vivendi and the outlook for reaching a sound solution to the remaining problems is good. It was in fact in Macedonia that I heard at the time about the Roma ORG population actually not having too bad a time there. I was unaccustomed to hearing this type of comment about the Roma in Europe LOC . P With regard to the problems afflicting Macedonia GPE higher education for the Albanian NORP speaking citizens deserves our special attention. Accessible higher education with which you have a certain affinity is an important instrument in the emancipation of population groups. I am speaking from personal experience as someone who attended the Protestant NORP university in Amsterdam GPE . I might never have studied otherwise. P Such an affinity and this type of higher education is also important in the development of the constitutional state and for the aptly termed mainstream society which needs to be strengthened in countries like this. The agreement with Macedonia GPE should partly compensate for the damage which this country incurred following the boycott we instituted against Serbia GPE which is at no cost to us but costs Serbia GPE s neighbouring states all the more. It would be beneficial if we could reorganise this especially vis vis the neighbouring states. It is only fair that we should regulate aid to Macedonia GPE properly now. P We are therefore quite prepared to support the liberals amendment to keep aid independent from the donor states interests for we need to give industry in Macedonia GPE and the region the best possible opportunities with the aid money available for reconstruction. I am more than happy to include Bulgaria GPE and Romania GPE in this as it seems to me a tactical and psychological error only to talk about the five CARDINAL countries of former Yugoslavia GPE plus Albania GPE . It is important to us that the economies in the region can stand on their own two feet again which can quite easily be done with the aid money. P The agreement with Macedonia should be seen as a door opening to the European Union ORG allowing this country to join even though this will not be the case in the foreseeable future. In the meantime we constantly need to start from the premise in our policy that it is desirable for Macedonian NORP legislation to resemble that of the Member States and our policy should reflect this even in the naming of aid programmes for Macedonia GPE . I would quote the PHARE ORG programme as an example. P Mr President the name of the republic is still a problem on account of the Greek NORP sensitivities surrounding it. I assume that the Member States will feel increasingly freer to use the name in their own language which fits the republic. If certain countries wish to use the words former Yugoslavia GPE then that is their business others need not feel obliged to copy them. It will not do to keep us under constant pressure. Hence my support for the sound report by Mr Swoboda PERSON we have come to expect nothing less of him and hence also my words of appreciation for the respected Republic of Macedonia. SPEAKER ID 223 LANGUAGE CARDINAL IT NAME Lavarra Mr President let me begin by expressing my personal appreciation of the quality of Mr Swoboda s work as rapporteur ORG . P Today DATE we are expressing a positive opinion on the opening of negotiations for a stabilisation and association agreement between the European Union ORG and the Republic of Macedonia GPE . We do so in the awareness that this decision the very first relating to that area is actually set in the context of an entirely new phase of our relations with the Balkans LOC . This new phase or rather policy identifies the prospect of integrating the region into Europe LOC as the only option for settling its conflicts peacefully. P Our agreement to the negotiations as set out in the rapporteur s explanatory statement is born of the conviction that it is right for Union policy to combine both a regional dimension and a more precise assessment of efforts made and results achieved by individual countries in moving towards the acquis communautaire. P This is the dual objective which I believe should be pursued. On the one hand we must maintain programmes on for example infrastructure preparations still premature for free trade and encouragement of economic and commercial cooperation between the countries in the area and on the other it is now appropriate to create a model of closer integration with the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia GPE as an example of the policy. P And there are several reasons why our opinion can only be positive. As we were able to ascertain during our missions to Skopje ORG there has been considerable progress in the former Yugoslav Republic GPE of Macedonia as regards the economy movement towards democracy and an area which is difficult and contentious enough in the Balkans LOC multi ethnic coexistence. On the other hand the price Macedonia GPE has been paying for the war in neighbouring Kosovo GPE is very high both in terms of logistic availability of NATO ORG forces and in terms of reduced exports to Northern Europe LOC . P I conclude Mr President by affirming that this progress is indeed difficult fragile and uncertain and it calls for constant vigilance on our part during the various stages of close and precise inspection that have long been advocated. SPEAKER ID 224 LANGUAGE CARDINAL IT NAME Costa Paolo Mr President Commissioner I rise to express the warmth and optimism with which the Group of the European Liberal ORG Democrat NORP and Reform Party welcomes the start of negotiations with the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia GPE . P We are extremely hopeful that along the lines set out by the rapporteur Mr Swoboda PERSON this agreement can represent an example to be rapidly extended to the other countries especially Albania Bosnia and Herzegovina Croatia GPE Montenegro and Kosovo GPE and as soon as possible Serbia GPE . P We are convinced a rapid start to these negotiations and their speedy conclusion is the only way to achieve peace in the region peace which did not automatically come with the end of the Kosovo war thus avoiding the recurrence of further disintegration and a return to chaos and violence with all the consequences of that in terms of continental if not world instability. P If the maintenance of peace and security is the basic motivation of the current courageous process of enlargement of the Union to the countries of Eastern Europe LOC that motivation must be present even more strongly in relations with Albania GPE and the countries of former Yugoslavia GPE . And that means decisively pursuing the kind of parallel enlargement to south east LOC Europe LOC that the agreements we are discussing represent. P It is in that quasi provocative spirit that we have presented an amendment suggesting the transfer of responsibility for south east LOC Europe LOC from Foreign Affairs ORG to Enlargement. P Very rapid and direct involvement of south east LOC Europe LOC in the life of the European NORP institutions has also led us to suggest that a limited number of observers invited from the national parliaments should be accepted into the European Parliament ORG and that staff from those countries could work in the Court of Justice and the Commission ORG . But if the development in the region of a more democratic NORP society and largely market based economy is to be encouraged we are convinced that immediate and concrete steps must be taken to intensify the struggle against corruption and to make international aid more effective for reconstruction and development. P With this in mind we have presented some amendments which I hope Parliament ORG will accept. First ORDINAL the former Yugoslav Republic GPE of Macedonia should be offered a customs tariff equal to zero CARDINAL for their exports to the European Union ORG and compensation for the progressive reduction of customs duties applied by Macedonia GPE to European NORP products on condition that the principle of joint customs control at the frontiers of Macedonia GPE is accepted. Secondly ORDINAL the former Yugoslav Republic GPE of Macedonia should be encouraged with adequate financial support to gradually link its currency to the euro as the first ORDINAL step towards the Europeanisation of the whole Macedonian NORP economy with the additional aim of eliminating any possible corruption in the banking system. Thirdly ORDINAL world aid and assistance coming into the region and hence into Macedonia GPE as well should be clearly multilateral and should not subject the beneficiary country to direct obligations towards the donor country. P Mr President Commissioner we hope the agreement can achieve all its objectives but we cannot delude ourselves that peace stability and prosperity in south east LOC Europe LOC can be achieved without dealing with the very wide ranging problems we are trying to eliminate. I am referring to the future constitutional state of Kosovo GPE the need to involve Serbia GPE in the region s reconciliation process and why not? new discussions on relations between the European Union NATO ORG and the UN ORG in the light of the new balance that needs to be found between humanitarian intervention and state sovereignty which I think calls for a change in the existing UN Charter PRODUCT . SPEAKER ID 225 CARDINAL LANGUAGE NL NAME Lagendijk Mr President Commissioner the war in Kosovo GPE has knocked everything off balance. This is certainly true for the relations between the European Union ORG and the western Balkans LOC . Since then expectations have been high. This applies to them and us. This is true on their part because whether we like it or not they are asking us for direct aid and they are wondering what Europe LOC wants from them at the end of the day? Is there any prospect of membership? This is very much on their minds. P But here too within the European Union ORG expectations are high. If we do things properly this may well be a first ORDINAL taster of a genuine common foreign and security policy. Will the Union manage to display a united front and develop a common policy for the first ORDINAL time concerning such a difficult regulation? It also remains to be seen whether the European Union ORG has learnt any lessons from the bad experiences in Bosnia GPE when it comes to providing aid and the slightly better experiences in Kosovo GPE . Can we based on the experiences in Macedonia GPE and in four CARDINAL other countries improve on this? P Against this background of extremely high expectations I do not think that I am exaggerating if I say that this first ORDINAL step namely the stability and association agreement with Macedonia GPE is vitally important. This is not the Union s only contribution. The debate on the Stability Pact LAW the debate on the CARA ORG programme and the financing arrangements in the short term are all pending. We are now dealing with the stabilisation and association agreements that is to say a medium term issue. This is why I think that this first agreement with Macedonia GPE is so crucial because it serves as a model. P I am convinced that the four CARDINAL other countries are wondering what is going to happen. What does the European Union ORG intend to do with Macedonia GPE ? Will it do the same to us? This first ORDINAL step is so important because of this model function. P Macedonia also serves as a model for another reason. The rapporteur has already hinted at this in no uncertain terms namely the issue of interethnic relations. There is no need to paint too much of an idealistic picture. During the presidential elections it appeared that things were not running too smoothly but compared to the rest of the region Macedonia GPE could serve as a model. We would gain a great deal if we managed to export this model to the rest of the western Balkans LOC with the help of the Macedonians NORP . P This model function also applies to regional cooperation. I could not agree more with the rapporteur a balance must be struck between promoting regional cooperation on the one hand and maintaining the openness towards Bulgaria GPE and Greece GPE and not cutting them off on the other. P Mr President Commissioner if we manage this first ORDINAL step successfully we will have gained a great deal. If we mess it up then we will have lost a great deal more. SPEAKER ID 226 LANGUAGE DE NAME Brie Mr PERSON President let me begin by saying that I have no problem with approving this very sound report in principle. I just want to point to one CARDINAL issue which in my view is not considered in the report and which raises a major problem in relation to Macedonia GPE and the effectiveness of EU ORG financial and other support. I am referring to the sanctions against Yugoslavia GPE . P Do not misunderstand me I too believe that we need to take effective action against the Milosevic PERSON regime. But firstly these sanctions have a far reaching and adverse impact on many of the neighbouring states too including Macedonia which find themselves in an extremely difficult economic situation as it is. Secondly ORDINAL the entire population of Yugoslavia GPE is being held accountable for the actions of Milosevic PERSON and his circle which is wrong on humanitarian grounds and politically counterproductive. So I believe that we should take today DATE s debate as an opportunity to call for a rapid end to the policy of sanctions as stated in Amendment No 10. SPEAKER ID 227 LANGUAGE CARDINAL PT NAME Queir Mr President we did not need to witness the end the Kosovo GPE conflict to reach the conclusion that after various wars in the territory of the former Yugoslavia GPE with their untold negative effects on the stability of the Balkans LOC a global and durable strategy for the whole region is needed aimed at guaranteeing peace and stability in south east LOC Europe LOC . This strategy which took shape in the Stability Pact adopted on 10 June 1999 DATE in Cologne GPE considers south east Europe LOC as a whole but simultaneously recognises the diversity and unequal development of the various countries that compose the region. The European Union ORG s contribution under the Stability Pact LAW now converted into what is called the stabilisation and association process represents a development in the regional concept the European Community ORG drew up in 1996 DATE for the five CARDINAL countries of the region Bosnia and Herzegovina Croatia GPE the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia GPE the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia GPE and Albania GPE . Its most significant aspect was the establishment of political and economic conditions intended to support the implementation of the Dayton ORG peace agreement and it should therefore contribute to regional stability. P So establishing relations between the European Union ORG and the former Yugoslav Republic GPE of Macedonia on a completely new basis and offering that country the prospect of full integration into the structures of the European Union ORG through the mechanism of the stabilisation and association process constitutes an important contribution to stability in the Balkans LOC . The assumption is that the countries are prepared to accept a certain set of conditions. The expectation is that we send them a politically relevant signal that it is possible for them to join us one day DATE maintaining respect for their sovereignty of course. P We are not deluding ourselves by believing that once agreement is obtained the mandate we are giving the Commission today DATE could constitute a first ORDINAL major step towards peace and stability in that long suffering region where the people have already shown they have the right to seek membership of our area of freedom and development. They have suffered enough first ORDINAL under the Soviet NORP yoke and then from the high price they paid for being forced to become part of the communist NORP bloc. P The evidence is that the former Yugoslav Republic GPE of Macedonia is politically and economically capable of establishing new contractual relations with the European Union ORG going beyond the cooperation agreement in force since 1 June 1998 DATE which in practice targets respect for the acquis communautaire especially in key areas of the internal market. It is true that the former Yugoslav Republic GPE of Macedonia still has a long way to go but given the political and economic reforms already made in the context of the cooperation agreement and with transitional periods accepted for certain domains the country will be able to fulfil the conditions for a stabilisation and association agreement. We share the view that its development is a factor for stability in the region we approve the terms of the negotiating mandate as proposed emphasising that what is involved is a bilateral agreement with the European Union ORG and we agree with the rapporteur when he stresses that this is the first concrete application of an integrated long term strategy for south east LOC Europe LOC and that the issue is how the Balkans LOC can be structured in the long term in order to guarantee peace and stability. The various references made to regional cooperation with the neighbouring countries in fact become politically relevant in this context. This agreement can and must become an example to the other countries in the region. That is why it is so important.
